showerReviews.reviewText: So one time i was here and i went into the change rooms and there was NAKED PEOPLE????!?!??! this is DISGRACEFUL and i want this fixed immedialey. Also there werent security cameras in t he changerooms and i felt unsafe. Also there was an old man staring me down the in the change rooms. After that awful experience i went to the slide. There was a sign thAT said "Slide closed" and i was like well i hope so hahahaha, it would be weird if it was open. But the sign was in the way so i just moved it out the way and started sliding. There was no water on the slide what a rip off, i went so slow and i got burns all over my body, probably didnt help that I forgot to put my clothes back on. Oh well. Once I finally go to the end of the slide. I fell in the water. OUCH. Then I remembered I couldnt swim. NOOO "NNOO ONOONO HELP ME HELP ME>" I start sinking. "NOOO NOO NOOO NOO THIS IS WHERE IT ENDS FOR ME!!!" ALl the other kids standing next to me were giving me filthy looks. . "HELELP HELLP IM SWALLOWING WATER NOW BUBBLE BUBLLE SCHCHSMHJS JHELP ELP" and THEN this guy with a ywllow shirt jumped in the pool and started fiddling with me, i was like STOP TOUCHING ME, GET OFF, STRANGER DANGER. Then i remembered what they taught me in school. So i just stood up and left. What a weirdo.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Car park is way to small for the size of the facility, and it is also used by workers in Hobart CBD who want free parking. The 25m pool could do with being re-tiled as it is showing its age. The 25m and 50m pools often have lanes booked for school programs, learn to swim, swimming competitions, and water polo competitions which limits access to lanes for casual visitors and members, hence overcrowding, even during off peak periods.

On a positive, the change rooms are excellent with plenty of shower and toilet cubicles as well as lockers in the members change rooms. The staff are super friendly and helpful, both lifeguards and at reception. The change rooms are cleaned regularly throughout the day, and lifeguards perform regular welfare checks in both the sauna and change room areas. The facility is also trans friendly so members of the LGBTIQ community should feel comfortable coming to this facility.
showerReviews.author: Rebekah Chambers

showerReviews.author: Arezoo Moslehi

showerReviews.reviewText:
Definitely the best Learn to Swim program in Hobart/Tasmania with small class sizes, upgraded and secure pool facilities.
Both of our kids have gone right through the Collegiate Pool's Learn To Swim program & are now involved in squad training through HC Swim Club (also based at Collegiate Pool).
We started our kids at Learn to Swim lessons at another centre - and the difference in the quality of the program and the delivery was huge - the Collegiate program was noticeably superior.
All teachers/instructors & coaches have been great right through our swimming journey, and our kids love them. The office staff is very friendly and helpful. Qualified instructors are very technique focused.
Private holiday lessons are a fantastic way to boost confidence and progression - they fill up very quickly, so keep your eye out and follow the Facebook page so you don't miss them.
I’d definitely recommend the Collegiate Learn to Swim program to everyone and get added to the wait list if you need to.
showerReviews.author: Jane Pederson

locations.title: Clarence Aquatic Centre

showerReviews.reviewText:
Normally wouldn’t review or post. But I felt compelled after my experience here.

Things look dirty and grimy. Including bandaids stuck to the side of the kids pool, The stairs going into the 50m pool look gross, and felt slimy. Drains down the side of the pool are loaded full of slimy gross pool noodles (do these not get cleaned out ?)

Pools were very cold. Despite them saying it’s maintained and heated. Which is fine, but when mentioned to the life guard and asked if they were heated they simply shrugged and said “ I dunno”

The change rooms are filthy, - in the female change room I went into a lockable cubical to get changed and there was what looked like poo, or chocolate smeared across the door and wall. Chewing gum on the walls.

Showers in the family room and female change room were awful, with only one tap for each, you are either frozen stiff or scolded. (Not ideal when you have children you’re trying to shower). The female showers were also full of hair, on the walls,
Doors and the floor. It truly looks as if no one had cleaned them before, ever.

The lady at the front desk has a poor attitude. She is rude, ignores you even if you’re standing infront of her, I was also double charged for my son once. But paid anyway as it didn’t seem worth the argument.

I tried phoning multiple times about swimming lessons for my son, phone rang out each time (different days).

Disappointed and sad, extremely dated facilities. I decided not to go back.
showerReviews.author: Cara McGrath

showerReviews.reviewText: My wife tried contacting the Clarence Aquatic Centre to enroll my son in swimming lessons on six separate occasions with the swim school manager unavailable and promises of a return call that never eventuated. The person at the front desk was always pleasant and apologetic (not their fault), our sense was we were not unique, but due we never heard back and so he missed out on a semester of swimming. We now have to look elsewhere which was not our preference. Disappointing and frustrating

locations.title: Anytime Fitness Hobart

showerReviews.reviewText:
Probably the most modern gym I have ever been to.
They have just redone the entire place and it feels very high quality with all new equipment that’s state of the art quality.
Heaps of locker room that can be locked so you can leave your things there and not worry about them being stolen as well.
On top of this, they have 2 stair masters!!! Most places don’t even have 1.
I’d recommend this gym to anyone in the area looking to get into fitness.

locations.title: All Aerobics Fitness

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’ve been a regular atAll Aerobics since 2013. Terry and Guy run the best gym in Hobart with a welcoming and friendly vibe and a strong community focus. I love the diverse range of classes and well organised and maintained equipment. Lots of praise for their commitment to cleanliness and hygiene. Cleaners and cleaning equipment are part of an environment that promotes a healthy lifestyle. I came back to All Aerobics when gyms reopened after COVID19 lockdowns because of their policy that all members needed to be vaccinated. I highly recommend All Aerobics.
Am sad to have to let go of my membership and will return as circumstances allow.
showerReviews.author: Melissa Findlay

showerReviews.reviewText:
Really good array of equipment. Gym was busy even in the middle of the day but never needed to wait to use equipment. Staff seen cleaning too. The machines are in good condition, the brand here is mostly Precor for cables and Matrix for cardio.

The only flaw is I wouldn't dare use the shower because it was very filthy. If they ever upgrade suggest better change rooms other than the toilets.

Otherwise thumbs up for price and value!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice range of equipment, but.
1. Showers are gender-neutral (as in shared), and it stinks there, like a lot. Sticky shower curtains, puddles on the floor, not enough hooks to put your clothes on.
2. No-one re-racks their weights. It's the worst! I saw personal trainers not once going through 7 stations with their clients and just dropping plates and bars all over the place. A person who works at the gym's entrance just stands there, reading emails. No actions are taken on the members who leave mess and weights behind.
These two issues are the reason I've left ZAP.
showerReviews.author: Anna Zabolotnaya

locations.title: Zap Fitness 24/7 Hobart City

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great gym in the city centre.

The majority of machines are all premium Life-Fitness, not the latest models, but they are in great condition. I would say this gym is more for isolation exercise. Large array of cable machines and plate-loaded machines. Would see it struggling if multiple people
came for a squat rack or bench.

I like the layout of having the hybrid exercisers downstairs i.e cross-fit style.

Much better ventilation than some other branches. Clean showers are a bonus.

locations.title: Zap Fitness 24/7 Hobart CBD

showerReviews.reviewText:
I really wanted to like this facility, firstly it's a lot larger workout space with wider range of equipment. Unfortunately it's not very clean, the sanitizers were all empty, no one seemed to be cleaning after working out.

It is very busy, the crowd just seems to be very lacking in gym etiquette. It felt a little like Planet Fitness, saw a member put a towel on one machine and water bottle on another, all the while he on the floor stretching!!

Hard for one staff member to manage I suppose, they were friendly on greeting and leaving though.
showerReviews.author: Stephanie Leung

Shower room door lock doesn’t have indicators of vacant/occupied, hence all the time have to till find a vacant room, and it seems like I try to break in occupied shower rooms.

locations.title: Zap Fitness 24/7 North Hobart

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was at this gym for a week while on holidays. I had a great experience at this gym! The location is super convenient, especially being so close to the city. What stood out most was the manager—very kind, modest, and an excellent communicator with incredible patience. A lot of credit goes to them for maintaining the place so well—whether it's the consistently stocked paper towels, clean gym space, or well-kept showers and bathrooms.

The equipment and weights are great, and the music in the background adds to the energy of the space. If you get a chance, definitely chat with the manager—whether it's about membership or training advice, they're the person to talk to.

Highly recommend. Solid 5 stars!
showerReviews.author: Priyesh Jain

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very quiet and peaceful spot that is calm most days and also a very clean beach that you could go for a swim as there is old shower rooms to change in that are no longer functional.
However if you do go for a swim there is an outdoor cold shower to get cleaned up.
There is also a good outdoor workout area and a kids playground for the little one’s taking in some beautiful coastal views .
If you like coastal walks there is a short one hear to be done which seems to be popular with a few of the locals .
There is a nice free public BBQ area hear sheltered and there is a water tap located on male end of toilets for Clean up of drinking.

showerReviews.reviewText: In cannot fault our stay, Gary was very friendly and helpful, great service. The room was very clean, well maintained with excellent amenities. The vista from the room was impressive in a very quiet location. We  will be returning to the Driftwood for a longer stay.

showerReviews.author: howardp704

showerReviews.reviewText: Couldn’t recommend this place more!! The recently renovated cabins were perfectly situated on Port Esperence, couldn’t be closer to the water. Gary was a fantastic host, providing us warm towels on arrival which were scented with their own unique Driftwood scent. The attention to detail in the cabins were thoroughly enjoyed by myself and 3 friends. From the robes, to the slippers, to the freshly squeezed orange juice maker. Very sad to have only been able to stay 1 night, but hope to visit again in the future. To add, one of us had left a few belongings and Gary offered to post them at no extra cost. A very kind gesture and just an extra layer of the hospitable nature we experienced at Driftwood.
showerReviews.author: Leah Mellor

locations.title: Hobart Showground

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hobart really needs this place. There are so few caravan parks left. It's central, close to city bicycle track  buses and shops.
pluses: water, power, level, good ensuite style bathrooms, good water pressure, laundry.
minuses: you will get to know your neighbours intimately, and driving down the streets at night will test your avoidance skills! Sites are on top of each other, roads are too narrow, longer rigs intrude on to the road, and getting on and off sites is a completely new skill test if the park is full. And not a tree in sight.
The opportunity to make a first rate park, sadly, has been missed. A tiny bit better planning and this place would be 5 stars.
showerReviews.author: Janine C

showerReviews.reviewText:
WARNING  - we planned a 2 night stay but barely made it through one night. It was not a safe place to stay - unhoused people set up tent right next to us and were heavily under the influence of substances - they spent many hours of the night loudly shouting profanities, wailing, screaming, (one woman in histerics and a man clearly enraged,) bashing around inside and out of the tent and saying threatening and disgraceful things. Their conversation surrounded themes of drug use - as if it wasnt strikingly clear enough that they were under the influence. We feared they would injur us or our belonings.

We were in a very difficult situation - afraid to call police where it would be obvious we had made the call and may be targeted by the offenders later that night. With no security or number to call from the motorpark - no gates closed come night or codes to open gates to guests only. Have since tried calling admin and after hours number with no one picking up. We certainly did not feel safe and I would not visit again.

Although the toilets and showers are clean and comfortable and access to nearby shops and cycleway are very convenient - i would not recommend unless serious changes are made.
showerReviews.author: Chantelle Takos

showerReviews.reviewText: Motorhome and RV parking is great. Ample space, the newer toilet / shower blocks are fresh and clean. Many sites on gravel are sloping but manageable. Can go powered, unpowered with or without water.  Rates change based on what you want and seem reasonable for  Hopbart.  Showers operate on $1 tokens for 5 minutes of steaming hot water ... more than enough. Dump point handy.  Camp kitchen is just a space with large gas bbq and a large sink. Walk 10 mins to main road to catch buses into city centre.

showerReviews.reviewText: We loved our 3 nights here. The managers are passionate about providing a top class camping experience. We received a warm welcome and allocated a site out of wind and close to bathrooms. The site was so pleasant - soft green grass. A few comfortable bare foot days and no dirt in the camper trailer - such a luxury. The camp kitchen is one of the best we’ve seen in 5 months travelling. The bathrooms and laundry were pristine and cleverly laid out with plenty to go around. And there was a separate urinal room for men’s convenience and reduced wet seat comfort. I was put off at first by the reviews commenting on the rules. But they were nothing that other caravan parks don’t give out. I highly recommend this park.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Bysterveldt

showerReviews.reviewText: Was a lovely house, the bedrooms are nice and large with comfortable beds. Kitchen came stocked with breakfast food and teas etc. There were two big TVs one in the lounge and one in the master. The bathrooms were beautiful and clean with very good showers. All the locks on the doors worked well, everything worked well. The location was pretty quiet and serene. Overall, a great place to stay!
showerReviews.author: Mia Osborn

showerReviews.reviewText: We had the pleasure of staying at Park on Park in Hobart Tasmania. It is evident the owners of this charming home take a great deal of pride in providing a comfortable stay for their guests. Steph and Matt go above and beyond in their customer service and care of the home and property. Love the combination of historical decor, antiques and modern amenities plus the abundance of books about this special island, history and things to do. Park on Park is in a great location just a short walk to the grocery store, Daci & Daci patisserie and the beautiful Royal Tasmanian Botanical Gardens as well as plenty of walking trails nearby. We did not rent a car for the first bit as it is a quick uber ride to downtown plus many sights and attractions including the waterfront and MONA. We had the pleasure of meeting our hosts during our stay and they are both lovely, kind people and an absoulte delight to rent a holiday home from. Well done Matt & Steph! Many thanks!
showerReviews.author: Carrie T

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a campervan. We stayed there when we arrived in Hobart and decided to go back there.We loved how it had the hedges are groomed gardens are beautiful. The shower,  Toilet  kitchen, laundry are clean. Very quiet and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Also they are on a bus route to Hobart and stops at different places on the way to Hobart. Just ask the office and they have timetables available.  I must also say that they have mini putt and a Thia Restaurant and takeaway it is definitely a must to eat. You aren't to far away from Richmond.
showerReviews.author: Alison Todd

showerReviews.reviewText: A favourite park - I’ve been to many across Aus so it means something. Staff are always kind & courteous & extend a helping hand for anything at all. Grounds were perfectly sculpted & amenities consistently cleaned. Wifi all around & CCTV being installed before we vacated. 15 minutes to the city but it feels like you’re in the bush. You won’t be disappointed.
showerReviews.author: K Cro

showerReviews.reviewText:
Easily the best caravan park we’ve stayed at in two years of travelling Australia – and that’s saying something! It feels like a peaceful, semi-rural escape, yet it’s only 15 minutes from Hobart’s CBD. The caravan sites are spacious and separated by neat hedges for extra privacy – unlike many parks where trailers are crammed together on concrete or dirt slabs.

You’re surrounded by a touch of bush, and every morning the local wildlife drops by: bandicoots, pademelons, native hens, and magpies, all so friendly they might as well be residents.

The owners and staff are incredibly warm and welcoming. Stuart and Patrick are the nicest guys you could meet, always up for a chat. Martin, the owner, is a legend for fishing advice and travel tips.

The amenities are clean and looked after.

Perfect location, great facilities, amazing people – can’t recommend it enough!
showerReviews.author: R R

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lovely campsite with clean facilities and a welcoming host. While it’s not centrally located, it’s conveniently close to the airport, just a 20-30 minute drive from the city.
The price was reasonable—we paid $59 for a powered site at the last minute and really appreciated that they fit us in despite being quite busy. The area is quiet and feels very safe.
If you’re a whisky lover, Sullivan’s Distillery is just around the corner, making this a great stop.
Thank you for the wonderful stay!
showerReviews.author: Fabiola Mazzocco

showerReviews.reviewText: Toilet and bathroom facility are not comfortable to use. Not very clean and not well kept. The kitchen and laundry area are acceptable although not very clean. Admin should prepare toilet cleaning tools for users to clean after for the next users if they are not up to the job. Same wise for the kitchen, kitchen towels should be given to campers to help clean up the kitchen. Reception does sell some food and essential items.

showerReviews.reviewText: Calling all nature lovers! This park has abundant wildlife with an array of amenities for people of all ages. We stayed at two powered sites and were greeted by pademelons and possums all night long. Park management also provide wood fires in two common areas to while away the evenings. Nice walk along Stewart’s trail to the Port Arthur Historic site. We, and other guests, encountered ongoing problems with codes for the security gate at the entrance of the park. Buttons aren’t clear and at one stage we had to wait 30 mins due to a malfunction. Bathrooms a little dated, but still acceptable. Good value for members of motor clubs. The friendly staff gave us some great local tips. Highly recommend!
showerReviews.author: Ben

showerReviews.reviewText: The park itself is very nice, however my poor wife was in the shower, when a cleaner (a male) entered the women's showers/toilets and shouted "You have on minute to be out!". This was well out of the posted cleaning times. My wife was covered in shampoo, and became terrified. We complained at the office, we were told we were in the right (no surprise) but that was it. Zero follow up, case closed you could say. NOT GOOD ENOUGH!
showerReviews.author: Rising Sun Buggies

showerReviews.reviewText: Last minute booking was easy even when checking in after late. Much more expensive than most parks however. Amenities were clean. Shower timer a bit of a nuisance for washing small children and when there is a queue. Washing machine and dryer was going to be $10 in $1 COINS which was a bit ridiculous, therefore the coin machine was empty.
showerReviews.author: Jacqui Rohde-Estes

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is just magical.
The amenities are clean as are the grounds within the entire park. These amenities are at the top of the park, so a bit of a walk to use them.
The mobile home section of the park was in the perfect location, the sites are close together, making for a squeezy environment at times.
We were having difficulty with the water pressure & we were informed of the problem with the water by the receptionist on arrival. 10ltr cask water is available for purchase ($10). Also when my husband did let them know of the water pressure the problem was fixed promptly.
On arrival the receptionist was amazing, so helpful & very informative. We were towing our small Suzuki behind our mobile home & we were informed of their “one vehicle - one code” policy, however the lady allowed us to take our Suzuki to our site to unload our items there. This was wonderful as not only were some items heavy, but the mobile home section was at the far opposite end of the “caravan park’s second car carpark”.
We took our Suzuki straight there after unloading & parked it there when not in use.
Unfortunately the same courtesy was not allowed to us on our vacating the caravan park’s second car. The young female receptionist was very adamant that in no way were we allowed to take our Suzuki into the park, hence my husband & I had to lug our heavy items on several journeys to the car.
Hence the 4 stars.
The location is perfect to visit the many locations nearby & 1.5hrs from Hobart.
Oh & the resident bandicoots were a common sight in the evening!
showerReviews.author: Di H

locations.title: Valley Campground

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great little park perfect for exploring the area. (Cockle Creek, Huonville, Kunanyi / Mt Wellington, Hobart multiple times.)
Very quiet and some huge sites (2 vans on our site, with room), there were lovely little markets on site whilst we were here, solar showers were refreshing! Very clean toilets.
Wood and small pantry to buy from. Sally was very friendly and helpful when we changed our plans last minute (and after that!), thanks very much. Will definitely be back
showerReviews.author: Marty Owen

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
The best campground I've visited.
Beautiful enviornment. You can hear the river. Large and private sites. Powered sites available, but I stayed in an unpowered site (unpowred sites are at the end of the campground where it is extra quiet and peaceful).
Composting toilet is very clean (no smell) and plenty of toilet paper and soap to wash hands.
Showers are solar powered. So as long as you don't mind having a cold shower if there is no sun.
It's quiet. The other guest are respectful and the hosts welcoming and helpful.
I would have stayed longer if I could have.
There is mobile coverage which is a bonus if you don't have Starlink.
Local wildlife comes out to visit at dusk and dawn which is an extra treat.
showerReviews.author: Emma Mary

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is such a lovely spot. Each campsite is bordered by trees, creating  a sense of privacy. There is a nearby creek, and lots of birds and wildlife (although the platypus didn’t make itself known while we were there).
There is river and rain water available, and wood available for purchase (with braziers available for each site). The composting toilet was always clean, and the outdoor showers were as expected: clean and solar heated (if the sun is out).
The site has lots of sweet touches: fresh herbs to pick, seats by the creek, a roadside fresh produce stall and a little library.
Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: Melinda

showerReviews.reviewText: My second stay here and I love it. Super clean cared for amenities (drop toilet with sawdust but not smelly at all) and solar shower only warm water during the daytime as others have mentioned. Very well kept sites with a lot of neat tracks and benches to sit on as well as fire pits and wood to purchase, peaceful sounds of the river running and a nice walking path along it. Would happily recommend and come back here.

locations.title: Base Camp Tasmania

showerReviews.reviewText: Me and my friends had a very great time! The rooms, the bathroom and the kitchen are always very clean. Free washing machines are great too. Beds are comfy, everyone has his own little window, shelf, towel and lamp. You are surrounded in the middle of the most beautiful nature and see wildlife all the time. The owner, Alana and Steve are very friendly and always willing to help with everything. We made a lot of new friends and enjoyed every moment!

A stunning spot, and the amenities are clean and excellently maintained. Chucked on my laundry and had a hot shower before I made myself a hot chocolate to sip in my tent.

Great work, gang. Hope to be back soon xx

showerReviews.reviewText:
Whether you're staying in the cabin, an RV or camping in a tent Base Camp is so accommodating and gorgeous.
Unbelievably stunning views absolutely abundant in wildlife that gather around the camp ground at all hours of the day.
So blissfully quiet and tucked away from the roads, a really peaceful place to stay.
The reviews aren't lying when they talk about how clean and well-presented this place is. Fitted with a large enclosed camp kitchen, well-kept bathrooms and laundry.
Not to mention that Steve was such a knowledgeable and generous host.
You'd really be missing out by skipping over this place, could not recommend it enough.
showerReviews.author: Kit Kat

locations.title: River's Edge Wilderness Camping

showerReviews.reviewText:
I didn't rate the rooms as *rooms* but I rated 5 stars as the camp sites were fantastic.
Toilets constantly cleaned, such a beautiful site. Very kid and dog friendly as well. Good pricing, lovely staff. Kitchen was handy, remember to have $2 coins for showers and bring lots of your own water. They have a place that sells pizza in Friday & Saturday, you can get breakfast of bacon and egg muffins or waffles. All well priced. I hear the coffee van is amazing as well, however the people who run it were away at time of our stay. Not much mobile reception but there are spots you can access it if needed.
Such a peaceful place to stay.
Highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Angela Hanson

showerReviews.reviewText:

Amenities available, and plenty of toilets all around the campsite. Very clean and no smell either considering they are drop toilets. Camp fire spots in each campsite and wood available to purchase from reception. Very reasonable pricing each night with consession rates available. Easy to find along the dirt road out of town.
showerReviews.author: Elizabeth M

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful camp grounds, plenty of activities and generous spacious grounds for large families/friends to stay. Amenities available, and plenty of toilets all around the campsite. Very clean and no smell either considering they are drop toilets. Camp fire spots in each campsite and wood available to purchase from reception. Very reasonable pricing each night with consession rates available. Easy to find along the dirt road out of town.
showerReviews.author: Elizabeth M

locations.title: Left of Field, Camping Gardens
locations.address: 2440 Gordon River Rd, National Park TAS 7140

showerReviews.reviewText: We’ve had an absolute blast at these incredible camping grounds, my partner and I wished we could have stayed longer. The property is very secluded, has clean facilities and is just beautiful. The gardens are lush and this place doesn’t feel like a caravan park at all! Adrien and Mel were the most hospitable hosts, went the extra mile and the both of us have never encountered anything like this while traveling Australia. We’ve loved walking around the property, and especially enjoyed the nightly campfire and extensive range of drinks at Adriens’ bar. Thank you for this wonderful stay and experience, we will be back!!
showerReviews.author: Sophia van Driel

locations.title: Mountain View Motel Queenstown

showerReviews.reviewText: This motel was a mixed experience for us. One of the rooms had a proper kitchen bench with a sink, but the second room had no kitchen bench and no sink, which was very inconvenient. One of the bathrooms also had no hot water in the sink, which really shouldn’t happen in this price range. On the positive side, they did provide basic amenities like toothbrushes and shaving razors, which was appreciated. Overall, for the price we paid, the facilities felt inconsistent and below expectations.
showerReviews.author: Vijay Dua

showerReviews.reviewText:
Service was good and answered on Christmas Day.
Rooms smells pretty bad to the point my friend was getting hayfever constantly until we left.
Kitchen smelled like mould, there were insect eggs all around the bin, stoves didn’t work, microwaved was good.
Shower was terrible, it flooded the whole toilet area due to leaking shower head. One of the shower head only had 3 streams and wasn’t pleasant as it it would hurt because of the pressure.

Can’t say I recommend. Pay extra elsewhere…

showerReviews.author: Gijs Hut

showerReviews.reviewText:
I might have just been lucky with the timing, but during my one-week stay, there were three days when I was the only guest, so it was very quiet and comfortable. Even on the other four days, the other guests were quiet and respectful, so overall it was a pleasant stay.

Also, the listing says there is free parking, but that’s a bit misleading.
In reality, it just means that street parking is free from 6 PM to 10 AM.
If you want to park in the actual parking area behind the hostel, it costs $50 per week.

As others have mentioned, the Wi-Fi is quite weak, so don’t expect much from it.

However, one thing that bothered me was that the shower on the far end of the men’s side (the one closest to the car park) barely had any water coming out. I had to check all four showers and use the one with the strongest water pressure each time, which was honestly a bit annoying.
Also, the toilet paper kept tearing every time I tried to pull it out, which was quite frustrating.

What really annoyed me the most was about the refund.
I booked for two weeks but had to leave after one week because I found farm work. The day before check-out, one of the staff helped me calculate the refund — around $400 including accommodation and parking fees. They told me to ask the manager, Jon, about it when checking out.
But when I talked to Jon on the check-out day, I only got about $190 back.

It’s simple math — just divide the total two-week accommodation fee by 14 to get the daily rate, then multiply by 7 for the unused week, plus $50 for parking (I had paid $100 for two weeks).
I was honestly surprised that such a basic calculation couldn’t be done properly.

So my advice is: if you plan to stay here, book for a shorter period first and extend later if needed.
That way, you won’t lose money like I did 😁
Hobart is a lovely place, so enjoy your stay!
showerReviews.author: ポプテver.II

locations.title: Backpackers Imperial Hotel

showerReviews.reviewText: Long and the short of it is you get what you paid for. There is a reason this place is rated as low as it is and it shows when you stay there. You will find that the only warm place in the building is the lounge on the second floor next to the kitchen. The laundry room is only open from 9am to 2:30pm with the added bonus of it being $16 total(8 for a wash, 8 for a dry) over priced to everywhere I have been and the other hostels in the area.

showerReviews.reviewText:
TLDR: stay at the pickled frog or one of the caravan parks.

I had the worst stay experience on my life here. Rude staff who didn’t bother to explain anything or return phone calls or emails, double booked rooms so when I checked in at 1 am all the beds in the room I’d booked were taken. The staff member was clearly very drunk when I called the after hours help number.

I was assigned a bed in a more crowded dorm then I paid for without a key. So I was unable to use the toilet or shower without loosing access to my room.

I was refused a refund or any apology’s.
showerReviews.author: Jennifer

Shared bathroom (no hot water in 3rd floor) and kitchen (open late and close early).You also have a choice whether shared room or not, they have available private bedroom but I think you need to book for it early.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’m a seasoned hostel stayer & I have never stayed in worse digs than Backpackers Imperial. I’m normally very glass-half-full & bigger picture but it was too difficult to ignore the many drawbacks of this place. It’s the cheapest hostel in Hobart & it is glaringly obvious why:
- hallway & common rooms are dingy, unloved & rundown (see photos) - nothing a lick of paint or elbow grease couldn’t fix
- WiFi in the room was on the blink constantly
- Reception hours are 9:00-15:00 - this is also where you get towels & hairdryers from, so good luck if you need to have a shower outside of these hours
- Kitchen locked from 7:00-22:00 - I had 2 early starts pre-7:00 so could not access the refrigerated breakfast items I had purchased. I never saw kitchen timings like this in any other hostel I’ve been in in Aus
- Laundry is only from 9:00-14:00!!!! This I couldn’t believe because what tourist or casual worker is hanging around the hostel between those hours just to do laundry? Hot take but I generally like to see local attractions when on vacation. Had to find a local launderette in the city to do washing
- Bathrooms weren’t well-ventilated - post-shower the loo rolls in the cubicles were limp & damp with water vapour from the showers
- My labelled cereal box got removed from the pantry simply because I didn’t have it in a separate plastic box, despite it being the only item of food I had out. The staff member I dealt with seemed to find the matter quite amusing and didn’t offer any explanation of why it was removed in the first place
- No atmosphere whatsoever - you’d honestly see more life in a graveyard, respectfully
showerReviews.author: Aoife Trench

showerReviews.author: Dominik

showerReviews.reviewText: My room doesn't lock. The locking mechanism  on the door is like a toilet cubicle lock, and it doesn't work. I just rang the call out line, the man who answered was rude, argued with me, I told him it's not acceptable to put a guest in a room that's unlockable, he said "you told me you've been here before". A whole wall is a glass partition facing into the reception hallway, covered by a heavy curtain held up by thin bamboo sticks. There is a fusebox on the wall. It feels like they have made an extra room out of spare office space and charge people for it. Then do nothing when you can't even lock the door. Will be reporting the hotel, I doubt this is up to code
showerReviews.author: Patty Crabby

locations.title: YHA Hobart Central

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lovely hostel, I made a reservation before and after my booked tour with Under Down Under in Tasmania and also spent several nights there during the tour. Overall I enjoyed it. A few points that you might not take into account before arrival - there is no elevator, so if you have a heavy suitcase it is difficult to go upstairs. If there is an option, you can use the lovely staff who provide a solution to everything. During my stay there was only one dryer that worked, which should also be taken into account if you need to do a laundry. Overall my stay there was fine, especially in private rooms with a shower and toilet.
There was some smell of sewage or mold in my last room ,better to check it in private room.There is one small kitchen,but enough room for everyone.The hostel also provides some facilities such as free pizza night and platypus tour or pub crawl.
In general I'm glad that I chooce this hostel,especialy because of the kind staff.
showerReviews.author: Daria Gushchin

showerReviews.reviewText: The staff is really nice, friendly, n helpful. Place is clean n quiet. Kitchen is accommodating. The only issue might be the light in the shower room, which is automatically turned on and off, so at night if you need to take some time in the toilet/shower room, the light might turn off when you're not even done. If you're afraid of the dark, it can be quite scary. But overall, I have no issue. Will recommend this place to my friend :)
showerReviews.author: Siti Juwariyah

showerReviews.reviewText: The staff is really nice, friendly, n helpful. Place is clean n quiet. Kitchen is accommodating. showerReviews.author: Siti Juwariyah

showerReviews.reviewText: The location was excellent; just far out enough that you avoided all the traffic and noise but not too far out that you had to walk for miles or drive everywhere. The owner was friendly and accommodating, and was very approachable the couple of times we dealt with him. The room was small but that was to be expected from a hostel. The room didn't get any signal for the free WiFi, which was an inconvenience. The toilet seat was a little dicky and as such moved around while in use. The shower cut in and out making it difficult and unpleasant to use. The room wasn't cleaned very well; the sheets smelt like old lady perfume, there was used soap with other people's hair on it in the shower, there was dust and dirt under the bed, and the small heater smelt when on due to the dust caked on it. There was a lovely skylight which was the only source of natural light in the room but the blinds covering it didn't shut properly so let in the early morning light. There was no parking at the hostel so I had to pay for street parking, which got a bit expensive. For a private double bed room with tiny bathroom I was charged $64, which after experiencing the hostel is too expensive for the quality of the room. There was an option when booking to request a quiet room, however I didn't sleep much due to the people in the room next to us making noise throughout the night and early hours of the morning. Overall I wasn't very impressed with the hostel itself. There is much room for improvement.
showerReviews.author: Erika Philpott

showerReviews.reviewText:
📝My First Ever Backpacker Hostel Experience – And It Was a Ripper!

I’ve always gone for Airbnbs in the past – nice places, but they sure do come with a hefty price tag.
This time, I stayed at a hostel for just $38 AUD a night – absolute bargain!🤩
Before I arrived, I did my homework –
read through all the reviews, good and bad, just to manage my expectations and avoid any emotional rollercoasters🎢.
Check-in wasn't until 2pm, but once I got there, the staff were super friendly and gave me a proper rundown of everything.
🍳The kitchen had all the gear you’d need – plenty of pots, pans, utensils –
and heaps of fridge space. You can tell they actually maintain the place too,
because the common areas were surprisingly clean and tidy. I picked the top bunk this time. Was a bit worried it might be a rough sleep, but turns out the bed was just as comfy as everyone said –
I slept like a log! the room had heating,
which was a massive bonus.
Every bed comes with a pillow, doona, light blanket, and even a towel
– how good's that?

I stayed for a week and honestly had no complaints. There was one tiny toilet downstairs that people online had a bit of a whinge about – and fair enough,
it’s definitely a tight squeeze.
But hey, the place is an old building that’s been converted into a hostel,
so you’ve got to take that into account. Luckily, there are two much bigger bathrooms upstairs, a few separate shower rooms – more than enough for everyone.
Sure, the building’s a bit old-school,
but it’s well looked after and kept clean, which I really appreciated.
All things considered,
the value for money here is unreal.
No wonder it’s often fully booked.

✅ Cheap ✅ Clean ✅ Comfy sleeps
🅿️Free parking

Would I come back? Absolutely!
showerReviews.author: Yo澳小記事

locations.title: The Happy Backpacker

showerReviews.reviewText:
A great stay overall! The bar below isn't too loud and the streets are quiet at night. Both of my sleeps here were excellent, which is the main thing. Kitchen facilities are good and there's a lounge too. Inclusion of a towel is nice.

The bathroom facilities, while functional, could do with an update. Check-in was bizarre and meant waiting at the bar below for a few minutes until a server was free to check in. Would love some signage or something. Check out was at 10am but I'm not sure how you'd check out early as this is when the place opens. Luckily the staff were quite friendly.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've stayed in a lot of hostels and this accommodation on the worst. Only positive thing is the location and the clean sheets.

There's a lack of space for any luggage, only a tiny locker and no other luggage room to store anything bigger than a back pack.

The bathrooms were not clean and bins were never emptied. No towel provided either which is the least I would expect from a capsule hotel.

The only communal space was the kitchen which is at the front of the building with full glass front looking out into the street so did not feel very private or relaxed.

Trying to sleep was also a disaster as their was no soundproofing in the very small sleeping pods. I could easily hear people walking along the corridors throughout the night.

I will definitely not be staying here again and as capsule hotels go this has got the worst reputation.
showerReviews.author: Sarah Ayres

showerReviews.reviewText:
Disappointing Stay – Not Worth the Money!Filthy toilets,cramped rooms and owners Ego is through the roof.
⭐☆☆☆☆ (1/5)

I had high hopes for staying at this capsule hotel, but sadly, it was a complete letdown. First off, the capsules are ridiculously cramped. I’m a petite person, and even I felt like I was suffocating in there. The bed is hard as a rock, and I could feel every single spring in the mattress. Definitely not what I expected for the price.

The so-called "privacy" is a joke. The thin, flimsy curtain that separates you from the next capsule offers zero soundproofing, so I could hear every single conversation and even snoring from the other guests. It made getting any sleep nearly impossible.

The cleanliness was also a huge issue. There were stains on the bedding, and the bathroom was filthy. I understand these are budget accommodations, but hygiene should still be a priority. The communal showers felt like a public pool locker room—sticky floors and awful lighting.

Additionally, the staff seemed disinterested and unfriendly, barely acknowledging my presence when I checked in. For a place that bills itself as a “convenient” option, it’s definitely not worth the price you pay. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you're looking for comfort, cleanliness, or a peaceful night’s sleep.Filthy toilets.
showerReviews.author: maculay TAS

showerReviews.reviewText:
Awful stay. The bathroom looked like a storage room full of junk, the shower was unhygienic, and the toilet seat didn’t fit. The heater and fridge were so noisy I couldn’t sleep, and there was no window in the room.
I contacted the owner on the first night and reached out to Booking.com. Booking.com told me the owner needed to email them to approve a refund for the second night, but he never did. He ignored all my messages and calls until the morning I was checking out. At 6:30 a.m., when I was about to leave for work, he finally replied and promised to contact Booking.com — but, of course, never did.
The place was dirty, noisy, and completely misrepresented. The owner showed zero care or responsibility. I left early in the morning because staying another night was unbearable. Avoid this place at all costs.

honestly don’t know how this place gets any positive reviews — they’re misleading and don’t reflect reality.

Nice picnic stop area, BBQ under cover and bins.

showerReviews.reviewText: Cool gym. Fairly small but great spot overall. Love that it has autobelays as a solo traveler as I’m not much of a boulderer. The showers were decent and the WiFi and tables were great for getting some work done between climbs.

showerReviews.reviewText: Kids had a ball. They loved the kids free rope climbing and the kids tunnels. My 5 year old couldn’t get up most of the trap doors maybe make them bigger than a 3 year old size. The rock climbing was great. The staff was friendly & nice. It was the first time entering the place so I had to fill out a waver form for my youngest 2 kids. To go rock climbing you will need to also hire a harness what costs $6. They also have two party rooms for the kids. There was a party on when I was there and it looked well set up with an assistant staff member to monitor the kids and to look after them. It’s changed names number is of times, at the present it’s looking okay set up, the building is very old, maybe a extra signage out the front would help with people who can’t access, Google Maps or navigation system. The cafeteria was nice clothing, coffees, soft drinks, toastie‘s and confectionery for the young ones nice rest areas including clean, toilets, lockers, and drawers and cupboards to put your bags and boots in with security cameras, watching them 24/7. I’m racing at four stars. Kids had a ball. I didn’t mind a rock climb after 10 years.
showerReviews.author: Jaycee Locklett (Xfactor)

showerReviews.reviewText: I loved my facial and massage (1 hour each) so left suitably relaxed, my face felt divine and hydrated, my body felt like the tension had melted away. I had Sammy as my therapist and she looked after me professionally and I felt comfortable in her hands. Sammy is passionate about what she does and is very knowledgeable. I returned to the Day Spa later in the week (today) and enjoyed a swim in the magnesium pool, a detoxifying sauna along with the steam room too. The facilities are excellent and the towels supplied for use are welcome for the sauna and steam room areas. There are water stations, so I kept myself hydrated, and the change rooms are well appointed, and everything feels clean and inviting. I hope I get a chance to come back again and I feel confident in recommending the Savoy Day Spa to others and trust you will have a beautiful, relaxing experience too.
showerReviews.author: Tracey Scott

locations.title: Lavada

showerReviews.reviewText:
Right, so, picture this: me, a bloke who thinks a "facial" involves shaving, walks into Lavada. Expected a room with a table and some scented oil. Got something that looked like a spaceship designed by a fancy perfume bottle.

This place is swanky. Like, "I wear silk pajamas to bed" swanky. I'm sitting there in my shorts, feeling like I've accidentally wandered into a Vogue photoshoot. The air smells like a garden exploded in a good way, and the decor? Mate, it's like a minimalist's wet dream.

Then the massage. Turns out, they know what they're doing. Knotted me up like a pretzel, and untangled me like a magician with a rope trick. Honestly, I reckon this place is basically a feminist utopia. They've got the whole "pamper yourself" thing down to a science. Me? I was just happy to get a decent back rub without smelling like a locker room afterwards.

If you're a lady who likes nice things, or even a bloke who accidentally stumbled into a high-end cloud, Lavada's worth a visit. 5 out of 5, would recommend, even if you're just there to figure out what all those fancy smells are.
showerReviews.author: Krish

showerReviews.reviewText:
I chose LAVADA completely at random during my visit to Hobart. I found the online booking service was very easy.
As soon as I walked in, surveyed the reception desk and met Michelle I was immediately confident that I was in for a truly positive experience.
The rooms all have solid walls and doorways making for a completely individual treatment. No noise or interference from anything outside the room. Sooooo important.

I travel around Australia full time in my caravan with barely any access to a bath or luxury bathroom facilities so I decided to go all out and have the Detox Spa Journey at $399.

My spa session with Michelle was truly amazing. And I mean that sincerely. She was so attentive, caring and gentle. Which was imperative after my leg surgery last month. I couldn’t have randomly chosen a better therapist if I tried. (no reflection on the other staff)

After being sublimely exfoliated then wrapped in a clay cocoon during a deeply relaxing head massage, Michelle remained in the room just outside the shower making sure that I was safe and didn’t get too wobbly with my new knee (I use a walking stick). This clearly illustrated to me an exceptional level of caring over and above the usual for me as a client.

The products used during the entire process including the one hour moisturising massage were excellent. I felt extremely soft skinned and smooth. On completion of my treatment I felt calm, relaxed and light as a feather.

Michelle’s attention to me as a client was nothing short of perfect. As someone who has had 100s of massages and dozens of spa visits over the last 30 years I found this experience absolutely faultless. Michelle is a client-centred professional and definitely a person who is particularly suited to her career as a spa therapist.

I could not have been more delighted with my time at LAVADA and would recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a personal and professional, heavenly spa experience.
showerReviews.author: Deborah Goodwin (Silasozzie)

locations.title: Hidden Cove Day Spa and Retreat

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the moment we arrived at Hidden Cove, we were wrapped in a sense of calm and care that only a truly special place can offer. Nestled in a peaceful setting, this retreat is a sanctuary for anyone seeking rejuvenation, pampering, and a touch of indulgence.

Jerilee is the heart of the experience—gracious, attentive, and effortlessly warm. Her hospitality made us feel not just welcome, but genuinely cared for. Every detail, from the soothing ambiance to the thoughtful amenities, reflected her dedication to creating a haven of relaxation.

The spa and massage treatments were nothing short of divine. Expert hands and tranquil surroundings melted away every ounce of tension. It felt like time slowed down just for us.

And the food? A dream. Breakfast and dinner were both nourishing and beautifully prepared—wholesome, flavorful, and clearly made with love. Each meal was a quiet celebration of comfort and quality.

Whether you're looking to unwind, reconnect with yourself, or simply be pampered in a peaceful setting, Hidden Cove is a gem. We left feeling lighter, calmer, and deeply refreshed. Can’t wait to return.
showerReviews.author: Sheki Ceman

showerReviews.reviewText:
I generally like the pool, but someone tried to steal from my backpack while it was left unattended at one of the tables (I left it closed, came back to it open). Nothing was stolen because my valuables were in a smaller pocket. But I told the receptionist about this in case they could warn the other pool goers that a thief was about, or check the security footage and discreetly ask the individual to leave.

However, I was told that they know about thieves, it’s a common problem, and they only send security footage to the police if something actually gets stolen. The receptionist’s attitude was rather rude and dismissive, as if I was the problem, and that I was making her life harder by trying to help others not have their valuables stolen.

I’m honestly surprised that, if the pool knows this is a common problem, they don’t have warning signs up or strictly advise patrons use the lockers.
showerReviews.author: sarah schmidt

showerReviews.reviewText: Great gym with 24/7 access, clean facilities and a comfortable atmosphere. The staff are always helpful and approachable, and the positive energy in the gym makes it easy to stay motivated. Whether you’re a beginner or a seasoned athlete, there’s a place for you here. showerReviews.reviewText:
If you happened to be in Launceston, Tasmania, the AF Launnie gym is worth a visit (Members Only). They have various equipment for training that I haven't seen in other AF. The place is very close to  Launceston CBD for shopping or tea. Parking is not free outside but you can have "limited" free parking with few minutes of walking to the gym.

I noticed, that towels during workouts were not strictly enforced and some sweaty homo sapiens just left their marks behind. (It's just a matter of reminding or giving them heads up) Staff never bothers to walk around even - for just a minute to say "hello" to members in the guise of reminding them to bring a towel or buy one from them or outside in any stores nearby.

I hope it's not all about siphoning the money from members but also maintaining the image of anytime fitness to be better than other gyms with good and discpilined members who follow proper workout hygiene.

There's only one AF in Launnie, no other options, but to be fair, the place is clean and well taken cared of, and the gym layout is small but nice. Kudos to the staff who take good care of the gym.
showerReviews.author: Alpha Twenty

locations.title: Zap Fitness 24/7 Mowbray

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member since January and I've been here a lot. It was a great gym, but now not so much.

1) You use to be able to get in via a key tag, but now the only way to get inside of the gym is via phone access which I have to buy data just so I can access the gym or it won't work. The membership is already expensive without having to pay for data just so I can access the gym I already go to.

2) I'm not sure what's going on with the vending machine, but it's been empty for months. This gym needs an upgrade like the one Kings Meadows got.

3) The window frosted seals have been removed. There's now no privacy for members and it's potentially dangerous as bystanders can now stare at you from their cars at the lights and pedestrians can stare at you while walking past. It's made it all that much easier for people to stalk you and make you feel uncomfortable. The last thing I want to do when doing painstaking exercises is to be watched by onlookers near by, that's almost akin to getting watched by someone while your in the shower, just no privacy.
showerReviews.author: Zano 93

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member since January and I've been here a lot. It was a great gym, but now not so much.

1) You use to be able to get in via a key tag, but now the only way to get inside of the gym is via phone access which I have to buy data just so I can access the gym or it won't work. The membership is already expensive without having to pay for data just so I can access the gym I already go to.

2) I'm not sure what's going on with the vending machine, but it's been empty for months. This gym needs an upgrade like the one Kings Meadows got.

3) The window frosted seals have been removed. There's now no privacy for members and it's potentially dangerous as bystanders can now stare at you from their cars at the lights and pedestrians can stare at you while walking past. It's made it all that much easier for people to stalk you and make you feel uncomfortable. The last thing I want to do when doing painstaking exercises is to be watched by onlookers near by, that's almost akin to getting watched by someone while your in the shower, just no privacy.
showerReviews.author: Zano 93

showerReviews.reviewText:
Original; My sons have used this gym for almost a year. Initially the gym was good. However the gym management made a decision to change key tags. I've read the generic responses on these reviews and whilst they claim that they've gone completely digital that isn't the case. They still give keys to selected members and goodness knows what the criteria is for being given one. This also has NOT stopped non members entering the gym and using the facilities. There are a couple of people who go there and regularly preach religion to members and use amenities. They just enter the gym with other people who are members. Also one of my sons is a vulnerable person and doesn't always have a carer with him so the removal of the privacy film on the windows has made him really uncomfortable. He's starting to look at obtaining a membership elsewhere. If you want the place to seem more friendly, put a smiley face on the window! As for the vending machine, that's an ongoing issue and management has been informed on a number of occasions. Their solution was to remove the product and leave the broken machine there.

Edit (reply); a typical, head in the sand response. As if security would arrive in an instant, that would take HOURS!  And read other reviews for not only for this Zap Fitness but others - people (particularly women) are very uncomfortable about being exposed to the general public, some feel unsafe and they don't feel like they should be put on display to promote your gym. One could even argue that this breaches your contracts with members. And regarding the key; one of those mentioned does not own a smartphone and has been continually stuffed around trying to get a key!
showerReviews.author: Louise M

locations.title: Cataract Gorge Reserve

showerReviews.reviewText: Cataract Gorge Reserve was the first place we visited after landing in Launceston, having heard all the rave reviews — and it absolutely lived up to them. The scenery was stunning and the wildlife was incredible. I can’t believe there’s no entry fee for a place like this. We went swimming both in the gorge and in the pool, and both were awesome. We saw heaps of peacocks roaming around (some of them even put on a proper show) and were lucky enough to spot an echidna (my favourite animal) which genuinely made my day. We walked around the entire gorge and also did the Zig Zag Track. Overall, it was a fantastic experience and I’ll definitely be back.

locations.title: Pod Inn

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for two nights and would not choose this accommodation ever again.

The pods are of very low build quality: thin hard-shell plastic, extremely noisy, and clearly worn. Every movement causes creaking and squeaking. The pods are fully sound-permeable — conversations, coughing, snoring, doors, cupboards and other guests’ activities are audible without any damping. Even with earplugs, sleep was severely disrupted.

Ventilation inside the pods is inadequate. There is a loud fan installed somewhere above the ceiling panels, but when the pod door is closed there is almost no proper air circulation. It becomes warm, stuffy, and unpleasant. There is no air conditioning. Pod doors cannot be locked; staff explained this is due to fire regulations, which effectively means anyone can access your pod. Guests are advised not to leave valuables inside.

Bedding was clean. However, the pods themselves are clearly aged and poorly maintained. Many show signs of patch repairs, adhesive residue on the shells, and general wear.

Each guest is provided with a small locker next to the pod. These lockers are too small to fit any suitcase; luggage must be stored in a separate, unsecured room. As a result, guests must keep clothing and toiletries in the small locker. There are no changing rooms. Changing is only possible either in the corridor or while lying inside the pod. Many lockers are damaged, partially broken, or poorly repaired.

Cleanliness is a major issue. Under the pods, cleaning is clearly neglected. Visible debris included underwear, socks, toenail clippings, food remnants, and heavy dust accumulation.

The bathroom facilities are completely inadequate for the number of guests. The men’s bathroom has only two sinks for the entire hotel. For most of the time, the area was visibly dirty, with water all over the floor. The hair dryer was sticky and appeared never to have been cleaned.

The showers are in unacceptable condition: visible mould on the walls in all three showers, a persistent musty smell, and overall hygiene that can reasonably be described as a health concern. Touching surfaces is strongly discouraged; footwear is essential. Toilet seats were frequently covered in urine.

The guest mix is extremely broad, which is not a problem in itself, but combined with the pod concept it creates significant issues. Guests appear to assume privacy within their capsule and behave accordingly — phone calls, conversations, laughing, coughing, snoring, and sexual activity occurred throughout the night. Noise never fully subsided. If even one guest is noisy, the entire room is affected.

We expected an innovative, futuristic sleeping experience. The reality was the complete opposite. Sleep quality was among the worst we have experienced. We would choose a shared hostel dorm over this concept, as behaviour there is at least visible and socially regulated.

We cannot understand the high number of positive reviews. The only positive aspect was that it provided shelter from sleeping outside.
showerReviews.author: S B

locations.title: Village Family Motor Inn

showerReviews.reviewText:
I didn't read the reviews before booking my stay, but overall I believe there has been some improvements since people's reviews from 5 months ago.

There is still more room for improvement but the sheets and pillows were clean and the pool area had been recently tiled. The spa heating was broken, and the heated pool wasn't very warm, which was a bit disappointing but overall I am satisfied with the price point of the lodgings.

Areas for improvement: It would be nice if the cupboard contained extra pillows and blankets, so we don't have to ask for them, as the reception is still mostly unattended. Would also be good if the cupboard contained a broom and dustpan, so we could give the floor a quick clean, as we stayed there for a week and it didn't seem that our room was swept for the whole 7 days we were there.

We ran out of toilet paper, so the replenishment of consumables in the rooms needs to have a bit more attention as well as the towels not being replaced every day. It would also be handy to have more towels for the pool. How can you have one towel per person? We wet the towel when we get out of the pool, how do we dry ourselves when we get out of the shower later (or vice versa)?

The room we were in had a lovely view but the hedge needed trimming because the new shoots were getting tall and blocking the view.

All in all, it was a good stay and I wouldn't hesitate to book again. I can see that the management are taking feedback on board, so please continue to do so and good luck with the rest of the renovations.
showerReviews.author: mentifresh82

showerReviews.reviewText:
Currently staying at motel for 4 nights (5 pers)

I have approached management regarding a number of issues since my arrival.

NOT RESOLVED
1. BBQ filthy and unable to be used: advised 36 h ago would be cleaned - still filthy.

2. No internet to smart tv- staff tried once 52h ago and have not appeared again.

RESOLVED
1. amount of cutlery not matching room capacity, no tea towel or dishwashing sponge.

2. Dryer $4 did not dry clothes, night mgr Chris placed clothes into motel industrial dryer

3. Out and about for 13hours, arrived back at 9pm wanting a shower but towels had not been supplied for the day , had to find night mgr Chris who gave us towels.

I look forward to having these matters resolved by management in the next 24 hours.
showerReviews.author: Janelle Bryant

2. No internet to smart tv- staff tried once 52h ago and have not appeared again.

RESOLVED
1. amount of cutlery not matching room capacity, no tea towel or dishwashing sponge.

2. Dryer $4 did not dry clothes, night mgr Chris placed clothes into motel industrial dryer

3. Out and about for 13hours, arrived back at 9pm wanting a shower but towels had not been supplied for the day , had to find night mgr Chris who gave us towels.

I look forward to having these matters resolved by management in the next 24 hours.
showerReviews.author: Janelle Bryant

showerReviews.reviewText: Very clean site, lots of great amenities, games room, laundry, camp kitchens with fridges, fire pit and even a herb garden you can use for your cooking. Staff are wonderful and my dog was welcome as well.
showerReviews.author: Wade Skinner

showerReviews.reviewText: Very clean site, lots of great amenities, games room, laundry, camp kitchens with fridges, fire pit and even a herb garden you can use for your cooking. Staff are wonderful and my dog was welcome as well.
showerReviews.author: Wade Skinner

showerReviews.reviewText:
Phone booking, 3 night, 2 adults, ensuite site. Area chosen for last of local towns yet to be visited on our lap of Tassie.
Wide site, all grass, with ensuite. We had ensuite site 7, the bathroom was disappointing given most Discovery Parks standard. Shower was just a bent rod with two curtains over a slightly sloping floor. The curtains did little to stop the floor of the bathroom becoming wet. Tiny hand basin, shelf next to it was approximately 20cm square, so useless for anything other than our liquid soap. Nowhere to put toiletries, one plastic towel rail approximately 60cm wide and  3 small hooks on back of door. All impractical for the intended use.  No thought at all for the practicality of the people who would use this space.
Hot water and pressure were good.
Laundry is coin operated, $4 for 20 minutes in the dryer was the dearest we had used across Australia.
Staff were lovely. Park was mostly quiet with limited road noise.
showerReviews.author: Wendy Taylor

showerReviews.reviewText:
In a word terrible. Arrived to reception closed , 20 minutes later a woman walking past managed to find the manager who was some how not very with it. Our sign in was like some weird interrogation but we persisted and paid 50for an unpowered duck littered piece of grass.
The boom gate should have alerted us to back out and drive off because it took quite an effort to get it to work.
Camp kitchen run down fridge filthy some hot plates don’t work. Showers have low pressure and signs everywhere telling you what not to do ( reeks of lazy management) .
One of the worst caravan parks I’ve stayed in in 25 years of camping and caravanning . Don’t go there.
showerReviews.author: Bunnyview 1964

showerReviews.reviewText:
Where to begin?
First of all, we want to exclude some of the staff from this review because there are, despite everything, some lovely people who were always attentive.

We stayed at this caravan park for three months, so we have a constructive and well-founded opinion. Furthermore, other backpackers had exactly the same problems as us.

1) Difference in treatment between Australians and foreigners, particularly the price, which changed four times during our stay.

2) The manager is extremely unpleasant; he never says "Hello." As soon as we drive above 5 km/h, he comes and yells at us, putting his arm on our van. He decides who he will reprimand or not (dozens of other reviews on this subject).

3) Cleaning is generally done from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m., which is random, especially the time when people like us who finish work like to take a shower or go to the bathroom, but we always had to wait and check the opening hours.

4) We were moved to a different spot five times: once in the middle of everyone else even though there were plenty of spots available, once someone came to disturb us, once in a sloping spot, once without electricity, once in a premium van, but since we "only had a small van," we stood out among the big ones, so we had to shout once and for all to get a good, decent spot (with Wi-Fi and next to the bathroom).

5) There were power outages in the shared kitchen a few times, the fridges are dirty, nothing to clean with, only one of the two stovetops works...

6) The machines don't wash well, our laundry came out with stains every time. The dryers don't work, you have to pay for an hourly minimum, and it costs $20 to $30 for a good machine. We've never seen a laundry so expensive! A few times, we've had people take out our laundry to put theirs in, even though we'd already paid for it!

The only star we're giving is for some of the staff and the cleanliness of the new showers.
showerReviews.author: Marion Pottier

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely terrible experience. We visited today (Sunday) with a group of family and friends (6 adults and 5 kids) for a day trip. We specifically paid for a site near water with a fire pit. The manager marked a spot on the map, gave us a key, and off we went.
​After two hours of settling in and getting a fire going, we were told to leave because another couple had booked that spot. When the manager arrived, she claimed we were in the "wrong" location. When we told her we simply followed the spot she marked on the map and that this wasn't our fault, she dismissively told us "I can't show each location to the visitors."
​She then forced us to move to a new spot that her map claimed had a fire pit. We moved everything, only to find there was no fire pit there. She didn't even bother to apologize for the mix-up or her laziness. We paid for amenities we didn't get, and she ruined our Sunday with her incompetence. Avoid this place.
We will definitely not be returning.If you are looking for a stress-free trip near Launceston, look elsewhere. The management here is completely incompetent.
showerReviews.author: Abdul Aziz Fazel

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have been here plenty of times over the years, but this is the first time we have camped here. We had a pleasant site by the river. We weren't too impressed with the amount of people that think it's perfectly alright to just walk through your campsite, or the attitude when we questioned it, I guess that's how it is back home for them. Price is reasonable. The showers and toilets are serviceable, and no extra cost. The hand dryers aren't heated, which was less than pleasant, combined with the cold water, when washing my arthritic hands in the cooler months. But that's only a minor gripe. Some people need fire safety education. Leaving fires that are well and truly going when vacating a site isn't really very clever, even it is by a river. Also, cans don't burn. We'll probably camp here again, but definitely not during school holidays. We imagine it would be pretty well patronised then. Especially as you can have up to 10 people to a site. $21 for up to 2, $5 extra per person. Must vacate by 10am, unless previously arranged. Not all sites have fireplaces, which are extra, but you can bring a firepot/stove as long as it doesn't sit straight on the grass, and of course it's not during restrictions. Also on the subject of fires, there's ample signage with conditions of use of the park, and one of those conditions is about where you can, and can't light a fire. It seems that a lot of people either don't comprehend English, or willfully ignore it when they just light their fire on the ground. I'm sure those same people wouldn't be impressed if their visitors did that to their lawn at home. It doesn't add to the charm of the place, random piles of charcoal and stones, that is. Great for little kids to play in. Plenty of room for the little uns to burn off energy, including a playground. Dog friendly. Camp kitchen, electric BBQs. A kiosk. There's plenty to like.

Update.

We have been here during school holidays, and it was a long weekend. Yes it was packed, but, at least the site we were at, there's plenty of space between sites, and it's not too bad. Yes you get the occasional squealing kids, but where don't you. Expect to have to book well in advance in those times though, at least if you want to be able to pick your favourite spot. River frontage is premium, and goes fast.
showerReviews.author: Stuart UnMcKleaine

showerReviews.reviewText: We love going here to camp as a family. Well looked after, showers and toilets make it convenient and they are cleaned regularly. Having to the little shop is great and the prices for food etc are reasonable. Cost of camping is very reasonable and there is so much to do and see locally. We keep coming back and our friends keep coming with us.  Can be cold and does have a plethora of bugs
showerReviews.author: Alex Grey

locations.title: BIG4 Low Head Tourist Park
locations.address: 136 Low Head Rd, Low Head TAS 7253

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at an ensuite powered site and really enjoyed it. The ensuite was a good size with practical bench space, and the owners were very friendly.

The kids had a great time - lots of activities and they loved the go-kart riding. The location is excellent, close to the penguin tour, lighthouse and beautiful beaches.

One small downside was the shower turning cold after 4–5 uses, so an upgraded hot water system would be a big improvement. Overall, a great family-friendly stay.
showerReviews.author: Carmen Ng

showerReviews.reviewText:

When we arrived the following day, both Tracey and Craig were lovely. The site was perfect for our long van. Amenities were spotless. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Very knowledgeable of their local area,witb great suggestions of what to do and the App is great Would definitely return some day.
Thanks so much for a wonderful 7 nights at Big 4 Low Head. Daisy Dachshund enjoyed barking at everything.

showerReviews.reviewText: Amazing camping! It has hot showers, water for carvan, clean toilets, and amazing natural places to see platypus. We saw 3 platypus.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I’m really enjoying my stay here. It’s free but a donation is requested.
The park has so much to offer and quite a history back to the 1930’s as a well formed swimming area. Very different to today’s focus on nature.
Lots of walks to find, play area for the kids, BBQs, covered picnic areas, toilets, bins, dog bags and of course, the camp area.
There’s also access to the rail trail although the signage to it could do with improvements.
Great place and recommended.
showerReviews.author: Paul Tooze (No Journey Too Small)

what a great park, approx 12 sites, all with water and sulage.

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful facility provided for travelers, wonderful garden walk with ducks, platypus, frogs, pademelons etc. Hot showers, clean toilets.  The only drawback was we noticed a couple of people sleeping rough, one hung around until late and then snuck into the disabled toilets for the night. Even though it is sad for them, I  had to consider my young grandchildren, this was not ideal.

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed 2 nights in an unpowered tent site. Check in was easy and quick. The staff were all friendly and the owner/manager walked us to our site. We were tucked away in a quiet corner out of the wind. The bush around our camp site was the perfect spot to view the wildlife, we saw many wallabies. The camp kitchen was great. Fully stocked with all you will need from toaster and kettle to fridge and oven. The bathrooms were clean and tidy. It was only a very short walk over the dune to the beach, with stunning views of the lighthouse.
showerReviews.author: Shannyn Davie

Kim was amazing and helpful to us. If we coming back then here! Also a reason to stay here was the penguins night tour. Can recommend it a lot, is just 5 minutes drive or 20 minutes walk from the campsite.

showerReviews.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed 2 nights in our 8m motorhome on a powered site on a Wednesday and Thursday early March.
Our site was right next to some bush and very close to toilets, showers, and camp kitchen. The gentleman who checked us in was friendly and informative without going on forever about what to do in the area.
There were only a few other caravans and a motorhome near us and it was very quiet with the sounds of the ocean from over the nearby sand dunes.
The facilities however, desperately need an update as they are old, with lots of broken items and the soap dispensers in the toilet area were empty in the ladies.
There are two men's showers and one had a broken off door latch just sitting there.
We did like the area and bike riding into Georgetown from there and enjoyed our two days.
showerReviews.author: Mike Englisch

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely setting of this small Campground on a creek. Amenities (open kitchen with microwave, fridge, teapot, stove), laundry, showers for 1 AUD all in best conditions. The hostess was extraordinarily kind: she did a phone call for me for a reservation, and helped with everything onsite instantly. Would definitely come again! Thank you very much!
showerReviews.author: Ulrike Dowie

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed at this park on 2 occasions during 10/2025. Well managed and maintained. Power and non Power sites available with creek side or sheltered sites to choose from. Firepits and wood available. Hot showers cost $1 for 5 minutes. Park is located 3kms from Mole Creek township which boasts a pub, fuel stop and a local takeaway. Cradle mountain, Sheffield, Devil's Gullet and Mole Creek caves are all within striking distance of the park. Devonport approximately 1 hour away, with Deloraine around a 30 minute drive. A simple camp kitchen is also available for use. Look for the resident platypus in the afternoon and make sure to give way to the free range chickens. Visited Oct/Nov 2025
showerReviews.author: Mark Xup

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed at this park on 2 occasions during 10/2025. Well managed and maintained. Power and non Power sites available with creek side or sheltered sites to choose from. showerReviews.reviewText:
We’ve just left Lake Leake this morning and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there.
Even though the fishing season is closed it was lovely to take in the views, watching birdlife, soaking up the sun when shining.
Clean amenities, showers 10/10 (coin operated $1 for 2 mins but lasted a lot longer), has a dump point, fire pit, camp kitchen etc.
There is also a Caretaker on site.
