showerReviews.reviewText: Great spot, close to Devonport for the ferry.  Excellent facilities with weather sealed camp kitchen. $1 for a 7 minute shower, more than enough time.  We had a couple of Little Penguins hiding in the bushes behind our caravan, noisy little buggers!  We were right behind the beach. $35 for an 8.5kg gas swap, very reasonable.  Sally at the park was lovely and really helpful.  Would definitely recommend this park.
showerReviews.author: Patrick Joyce (Pat Joyce)

showerReviews.reviewText: Great spot, close to Devonport for the ferry.  Excellent facilities with weather sealed camp kitchen. $1 for a 7 minute shower, more than enough time. showerReviews.reviewText:
A hidden gem close to Devonport and the Spirit of Tasmania! Came off the ferry around 7pm and still got to set up camping gear before sunset at 8pm. Really close to the beach and even saw some little penguins at night 🤩

Nice friendly staff and great clean facilities, especially nice to have an indoor kitchen to keep warm from the cold and wind! The only slight down side is coin-operated showers, made us a bit nervous while showering. However, would definitely still come back next time :)
showerReviews.author: Sunny Yang

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
Highly recommend. After 3 months traveling around Australia, this is one of our favorite spots. We originally booked 2 nights, liked it so much we extended for a 3rd night before continued our travels. We also planned a return stay when back in the area, booked for 2 and kept extending. In total we spent 10 nights.

The sites are larger, grassed and fairly flat. Some have sea views and others are protected by bushes and growth. Power and water is $40/night for 2 adults, you get discounts with longer stays. The amenities are great, newer and very clean. Individual toilet and shower cubicles. $1/7 minutes shower with good water pressure. Laundry is $3/wash and $3/dry plus have nice outdoor drying area. The kitchen is great. 2 fridges, 2 4 burner electric cook tops, 2 sinks and 2 outdoor BBQs. Again, spotless.

There is a nice pathway for walks, easy access to the beach. You can see penguins on the beach and they often come into the park. It's also easy to walk into town centre or local business area.

Angelina and Patrick were great to deal with. Always made us feel welcome and never made us feel like it was an inconvenience for extensions, even on super busy long weekends,  and answered any questions we had. They made it hard to leave, thanks again!. We would happily stay again if in the area
showerReviews.author: Helen Rimmer

locations.title: Strahan Village

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for 2 nights in the hotel rooms up the top, had a nice view out the window onto the water and the room was clean and modern. Not sure if people have read the accommodation types when booking, but you need to book the better rooms for the nicer rooms and view.

Check in at the main reception was easy and check out even easier. Plenty of parking up the top carpark, we went in winter though so I imagine busy in summer.

The split level room was nice and the "fire" heater was nice. 2 large TVs too. Small area with a mini fridge and kettle etc was plenty big enough for us to make drinks and have cereal of a morning.

Bed was comfy and there was a towel heating rack in the bathroom. Nice brand of shampoo etc too.
showerReviews.author: Lauren Burk

locations.title: Discovery Resorts - Cradle Mountain

showerReviews.reviewText:
Perfect location close to the shuttle down into Cradke Mountain. Amazing amenities - 3 kitchens, one with a lounge area. Great toilets/shower facilities with great cleaning!

Camp sites a bit weird. We had one we had to share with others from the other side which felt weird. Maybe a barrier halfway would help share the space.

Insane wildlife seen here - saw an echidna whilst walking over to the shuttle!

Great little shop too! And very friendly fellow campers. Great spot!

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited this campground recently when we were visiting Cradle Mountain. The campsite is in a fantastic location - you can actually walk to the visitor centre from it !! Facilities were perfect, kept really clean and shower was lovely and hot :) laundry and driers worked well. We were in a motorhome on a powered site, and we got a good balance of luxury facilities without loosing the feeling of being in the wilderness ! Would recommend to anyone exploring Cradle Mountain :)

Nothing amazing but good accomodation for cradle at the right price.

locations.title: Trevallyn Reserve

showerReviews.reviewText: Trevallyn reserve offers walks views and activities on land that has goegraphical,  historical and cultural significance for pre and post European settlement. The flora and fauna and features of this place can be explored through tours provided by members of the local Aboriginal community, or by accessing the myriad of walking or mountain biking tracks available. In the warmer months there are great swimming opportunities in grounds that have ample play equipment for kids and amenities for all.

locations.title: Peppers Silo Launceston

showerReviews.reviewText:
Took a rare family weekend away, and the stay at Peppers was perfect. The location was excellent - on the river, lots of parking, and next to a PHENOMENAL all-ages playground.
Room was extremely spacious and clean - we stayed in one of the old silo rooms with the curved concrete wall? Peppers had made up a roller bed for our 8 year old which was appreciated. Bathroom was enormous with very large walk in shower and separated toilet cubicle as well as all usual amenities. The touches of natural finishes in the room and hotel was a nice Tassie vibe.
The restaurant was a standout. We had dinner there only one of the two nights, and every dish was perfect. We had each of the specials (2 x entrees, 2 x mains) and our picky eating child ordered a second serving of the kids fish and chips after finishing the first one. Service was friendly but not overbearing, swift and professional. Not cheap, but it was one of the best dinners we have had in years.
Will be highly recommending Peppers Silo Hotel at Launceston to others, and probably be back there ourselves again next year.
showerReviews.author: Rachel Jenkin

showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff at reception were friendly and professional with the exception of the lady who checked us in, she was very direct, officious and not at all welcoming. This unfortunately coloured our experience a little.

The room was very nice, the welcome champagne and chocolates for my birthday were excellent and very much appreciated. The balcony was amazing and we enjoyed sitting out there watching the world go by. The housekeeping was a little disappointing with our water glasses not washed properly leaving lip marks.

Overall a little underwhelming for what we thought was a more prestigious facility.  As this was for a major birthday we booked a more luxurious room and we were expecting a little more.

The room was facing the road, but it was really quiet, we didn’t get any of the city noise I was expecting. The shower was large and had the best pressure and hot water, and we had decent sized share bottles, not little half serve sized products to use. The hotel front desk service was helpful and polite.
I would definitely recommend and stay again.

showerReviews.reviewText: Grabbed a shower here after the annual Glow run Devonport, it was very therapeutic
showerReviews.author: Jarrod Moore

showerReviews.reviewText:
Oh, Zap Gym, where do I even begin? Let me start by saying that this gym is the epitome of fitness perfection. I mean, who needs fire exits anyway? You'll be too busy sweating in the sauna and showers to even think about escaping in case of an emergency. That's just a minor detail, right?

But let's talk about the real reason you're here: the exercise. Let me tell you, my muscles have never been so swollen and bulging as they are after a workout at Zap. The weights practically lift themselves when I'm there. I think it might be the special air they pump in that gives me superhuman strength. Or maybe it's the unicorn tears they sprinkle on the equipment.

And the best part? The membership price! It's practically a steal compared to other gyms that charge an arm and a leg for the same mediocre workout experience. I mean, sure, you might have to sacrifice a limb or two to get out of the sauna in case of a fire, but at least you're not sacrificing your wallet for a gym membership.

Overall, I highly recommend Zap Gym to anyone who wants to feel like a Greek god or goddess. Just don't forget to bring a fire extinguisher and a towel, because things can get pretty hot in there. But hey, that's just part of the fun, right?
showerReviews.author: Nathan Sweeney

showerReviews.reviewText:
THE TOWELS  ARE OPTIONAL GYM.....

The worst GYM in Devonport .

I have been in Gyms since I was 16 and I'm now 50. This is probably the worst gym of them all. Staff with no idea and who I have zero confidence in. They spend 90% of their time chatting to friends instead of making sure the gym rules are adhered to. This is the gym where towels are optional but you get boned in for not wearing a mask in the door only to take it off 5 seconds later. The gym also has poor maintenance of gear and facilities. Toilets are disgusting and the whole place has a dirty feel about it. This place will die a fast death when Anytime fitness arrives in the area.
showerReviews.author: N.B. Williams

locations.title: Splash Devonport Aquatic And Leisure Centre

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic swimming facilities, set in beautiful parkland.  I got lucky as the 50m outdoor pool just re-opened the week of my visit (closed during colder months).  The 50m outdoor pool lanes are wide, has shaded benches, although not very deep - I could still stand on the floor at the deep end. There are coin lockers that operates on (refundable) $2 coin. As I didn't carry coin, they kindly lent it to me.  The water in private showers were reasonably hot although the showerhead height & angle wasn't ideal, so taller people might struggle to wash the tops of their head. Some nice short bush walks/cycle tracks surrounding this venue as well.
showerReviews.author: Mario

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic swimming facilities, set in beautiful parkland.  I got lucky as the 50m outdoor pool just re-opened the week of my visit (closed during colder months). showerReviews.author: Mario

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a double amputee swimming can be terrifying. What if I don’t
float? It’s been ten years since I got in a pool, and I had my legs
back then. So, this is a big deal!

Today is the first day that I have used the Cérge app to book a visit to Splash Devonport Aquatic and Leisure Centre. Normally with myself being a double aka (above knee amputee) in an electric wheelchair I can often find I am a bit apprehensive going to new places. I’m never quite sure if the new places I’m going to will be suitable for my needs and if arrive and then must just go home.

It’s a bit annoying and anxiety inducing.
A lot of businesses I have been to previously don’t have sufficient
room to manoeuvre around in a big wheelchair like mine, I would
steer clear of venues like this. I have found some not suitable to
my needs which can be quite off putting and disappointing. I was
very excited to see Cérge has its very own Access and Inclusion
guide with a visual story.

So, I looked at that before going. I was able to see photos of the
doorways, the pathways, entrances, everything! There as so much information it was excellent.

Being the first time using Cérge I wasn’t sure how it would all go,
but I found the app quite easy to use and I shouldn’t have
worried. I guess I’ve just had so many disappointing experiences in the past.

I arrived at Splash and welcomed by Hamish who made me feel
very at ease and was able to give me a full tour of the facilities. Let me tell you Splash is a great place with many pools and a
hydrotherapy pool which is accessible by their own wheelchairs,
with the use of a hoist. A sling in the spacious changing room that has plenty of wheelchair access. After seeing all the equipment I’m confident enough to know now that it will be no problem for me and my carer to visit in the future and I can now add swimming into my life.

They also have a full leisure centre with many different exercise
classes and a huge fully equipped gym.
I have found in the past that I can feel a little unsettled as I don’t
feel welcome and not always seen if that makes sense, as well as some places aren’t set up for wheelchairs and people with
disability like myself.

However, that was something I did not have to worry about today,
I felt welcomed and included thanks to Hamish who answered all
my questions and showed me around the whole facilities at
Splash.

I hope more business will start using and offering Cérge in the
community. Being on the app, it shows me you are trying and you
care. There is nothing else like it that I have come across. I know
that myself and so many others who have any disability or
restrictions will find the Cérge a benefit.

If Cérge was in every business just like EFTPOS is I know I would
have more confidence in experiencing different places that in the
past I may never would tried. This helps me have a fuller life and
more things to do and that is very exciting!
showerReviews.author: Cérge Tech

showerReviews.reviewText:
Avoid & here’s why.
The first thing you encounter is the smell, then what causes the smell on your shoe, wallaby dung at every step, then you go to have a nice warm shower, push the button to get hot water, then 4.5 minutes later the hot water stops, no other state has the audacity to impose such a disrespectful idea on people & it’s freezing their in mid December. Pros - well, non you can’t get in another million places in Australia, the owner says & quote - it would cost a fortune to not have hot water timers unquote. So to that I think, well every other state has no problem, but they did give me a wave from their 120k tricked up 4WD🤕
add to that the sign in the ammenities that reads - Feel free to wipe down the benches, now ask yourself why it would be written like that, as a Phycologist I can ashore you the hot water mentality showcases what the park management thinks of its guests, so again Avoid.
Ps- the sign on the back of the shower door says - Please turn taps off. Now the reason it says that is due to the hot water stopping, it does not just get cold it stops altogether, so if they have not been turned off and you push the button then get ready for a burst of cold water, keep in mind your already freezing, so the previous person hasn’t turned off the tap, but can you blame them, all they are doing is reaching for cloths to get warm, yeah big avoid
showerReviews.author: Time Traveler 2020 AD

locations.title: Bay View Holiday Village
locations.address: Unit 2/12 N Caroline St, East Devonport TAS 7310

showerReviews.reviewText:
My partner and I had organised with Craig (the park operator) to move in to a permanent rental cabin on Monday the 1st of December. We have called up today (30th of November) to discuss what time would be best for us to come and pay our security deposit/ move in tomorrow and have been met with hostility and false words. Craig has started ignoring our calls and when I called the front desk I spoke with a very nasty woman named Sheryl who not only speaks in a disgusting manner to customers but blatantly was disrespectful and was claiming we had to double the deposit that was agreed upon with Craig 5 days prior. Then Sheryl said that I need to call back tomorrow (the day we were told to arrive to move in) because apparently they aren’t open on a Sunday, even though she answered my call at the front office and they are operating today. Then when I tried to speak about what Craig had said to us prior about moving in she hung up in an extremely rude manner after talking over top of me and telling me I was a rude person for only trying to get in contact when the owners were ignoring my calls.

0 stars, do not stay here if you value common decency and honesty. The park owners and operators are liars and like to toy with peoples lives for amusement then dodge your calls to avoid responsibility for their actions. We have since declined other living situations because we had been told we could move in on the Monday and now apparently we were declined for no reason other than a few days had passed since the agreement was made.
Very putrid, wishy-washy and unprofessional behaviour from a customer based establishment.
showerReviews.author: Brogan Lynton

locations.title: Girdlestone Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
The placement of the venue/grounds in itself sheltered from weather, accommodated with a grand stand for shelter - especially important for the vulnerable.
The parking was plentiful, and directional signage on approach clear and precise.
The grounds being open to refreshment vans for spectators, volunteers, and sports participants very pleasing.
The lawns in the recreational areas kept and clean, sports tracks laid out clearly, sound system all around audible, crisp, and clear, access to clean amenities.
As a spectator, All of the above comments proved for a complete and  thoroughly enjoyable day. Highly recommend this venue.
showerReviews.author: Tina roberts

This place should be a model for caravan parks. The services are excellent and the place is a bit in the middle of nowhere a bit but saying that 15 minutes from big towns in most directions. We have had experience with this before. Backpackers will soon ruin the chance to get into these places because all the owners we speak to have had enough.

Great park we will definitely return.

This campground was absolutely amazing. The staff member at the reception who welcomed us was super nice. Both the women’s bathroom and the kitchen were incredibly clean! And this is the first campground I’ve ever stayed at that provides bath mats in the showers,such a great detail.
Although it’s next to the railway and you can hear the trains passing by sometimes, I don’t think it affects the overall experience.
We only stayed for two days, but I really wish we could’ve stayed longer.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We booked into this park but were given a site at a Council owned park at Buttons Creek. This 'spill-over' ground is leased to Big 4 for a couple of months over Christmas.
One of the worst parks I have ever stayed at. We were packed in like sardines, no dump point for portable toilets and no entertainment facilities for kids. The very dated toilet/shower block for paying customers was way too small for the number of campers. At 7am there were 6 women lined up outside, waiting for a shower.
As a comparison, we recently returned from a W.A. trip and the most expensive park we stayed at at Exmouth, near Ningaloo Reef, was HALF the price of the tariff we paid in Ulverstone (and we had a Big 4 Member discount)!
Despite these criticisms, we discussed our issues with the staff at Reception and they were all lovely people and agreed our feedback was valid.
showerReviews.author: Wayne Busby

showerReviews.reviewText: Spectacular white sandy beach nestled within an azure blue water cove with a lovely cafe and amenities right on the foreshore. The perfect spot for a family weekend getaway.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Phone booked for two nights but extended to 3. Powered site, amazing views over the harbour and really lovely owners. Site sizes and views vary, amenities are unisex separate toilets with basin and a row of showers with basin. Showers are $1 coin operated (about 3 minutes) as park is on tank water. Washing machine available with an honesty box $4 per load. Plenty of line space.
Roads in and out are steep and windy in parts. The park itself is terraced on a steep hill. We used low range and took it slow and had no issues.
Plenty of Pademelons grazing every afternoon, lots of photo opportunities.
showerReviews.author: Wendy Taylor

showerReviews.reviewText: We recently had two nights on a caravan site at the park. Darren met us on arrival and was welcoming and very pleasant. He showed us to our site and guided me as I backed our van. The park and its setting is exceptional! The amenities are outstanding and incredibly clean and well maintained. There is obvious pride in owning and managing this park and making sure that everyone has a wonderful stay. Thank you Darren and Suzanne for your hospitality and we will definitely be return guests 😊

locations.title: Port Sorell Caravan Park

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed in a powered site.  Dean was super helpful. He tries to make sure you have room to move if they are not too busy with bookings. He is very helpful with sightseeing info. The showers are timed, which some people may not like. I think 5 minutes is adequate. The location is great. Close enough to shops if needed and right on the foreshore with a lovely path for walking or a very short walk to the jetty for a fish or swim. Great little spot, we thoroughly enjoyed our overnight stay there.
showerReviews.author: donna curtin

locations.title: Apex Beachside Holiday Park West Ulverstone

showerReviews.reviewText:
While I haven't stayed at the caravan park I can vouch for their exceptional service. We had a family member come down to Tassie who is a paraplegic and unfortunately couldn't use her hoist to shower at the residence she was staying at, I rang around multiple places in Ulverstone to seek out where we could have her shower, no one knew where or simply couldn't have her shower in their disabled bathroom.
West Ulverstone Apex Park did not hesitate to allow her to use their facilities so she could shower during her visit here. We are extremely grateful for their service, definitely a community we need. 🥰
showerReviews.author: Abbey

locations.title: Formby Hotel

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good value for money - stayed in one of the dorm rooms, obviously you don't expect the Four Seasons for the price, but the room was clean, presentable, linen was provided and the bed was comfortable. Good bathroom & shower facilities.

Live music was noticeable in the room on Friday night but not enough to stop me getting good sleep. Was finished by 11pm.

Would gladly stay again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
While this place has plenty of activities, it is not worth the cost to stay.
The place look like it hasn't been upgraded since the 90s and has lots of warn areas and needs a good paint everywhere.
The pool was dirty and the floor was gritty, the spa as green with a brown ring around the top of the water level.
While the rooms themselves were newish, it was not suitable for a family of 4. They charge $20 for the cleaners to wash the dishes and there were at crawling up and down our wall.
Some positives were the splash golf ($18), the mini golf and the peddle boats and bikes.
showerReviews.author: Yvette Preyser

showerReviews.reviewText: Really tired room. Advertised for 4 people, but there was only one towel rail, no table and you couldn't sit on the couch if someone was standing by the sink the room was so small. The basin was so small that you literally couldn't even fit a toothpaste tube on it. Not even a box of tissues, just a handbag pack of 10. 'Golf side villa' and we had a view of a pine tree right out the door. No extra pillows would have been handy, Kmart electric blankets and a lot of wall damage. The pool and sauna are screaming for upgrades. The ceiling was leaking, theres mould around the doors and the spa looked green. Wasn't brave enough to get in. Restaurant was nice but overpriced. Nice area for families, but im not sure I'd rush back to the accommodation.
showerReviews.author: Rhianna

showerReviews.reviewText:
My girlfriend and I very recently stayed and booked a hotel room for our anniversary.
We enjoyed the general area and the atmosphere of the Swiss village. For what you pay for you get when it comes to the hotel room but the Bar and activities are hit and miss. I can positively say We had so much fun with splash golf and semi fun with Mini golf. Splash Golf was new to us and very exciting would recommend.
The Stores are lovely and the people who work at the place a genuine and nice.
The main issues I had with the resort is the pool.
The pool needs to be revamped completely the hot tub was semi gross didn't look clean. The sauna room smells like wet Goat and the changing rooms although had clearly had some upgrades. the doors leading into the rooms had some rust and paint coming off. The BLACK MOLD on the tiles of the wall near the pool and up in the skylight glass above the pool is a clear health and safety problem. Besides the bad there is good. The swim was fun wouldn't personally put my head under this particular pool water but still enjoyed the swim. Definitely revamp the pool. Overall Rooms expirence in the room was good besides the touchy shower and the TV having so many streaming services the most I've ever seen at a hotel resort but no hotel accounts to watch any of the streaming services. the atmosphere of the room was great it definitely is what you pay for when it comes to the bed it was comfortable. Would I recommend this place for family's yes. I personally don't feel like I would stay more than 2 nights for just a couple but overall 7/10.
showerReviews.author: Corey Lonergan

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's older style but unique accommodation. I read the reviews after booking and started feeling nervous. I got there and spoke to the onsite manager, told him I was concerned and he reassured me the room would be spotless. Any problems and he will sort it immediately.
We got a 3 bedroom family room, it was clean, freshly painted and the bedrooms were large. There was window seats in the rooms, so cool and in the main room we had chairs and a little coffee table. The layout was unique and we liked it. Bathroom was tiny but the shower head and water pressure was awesome. Kitchenette was usable but nothing to write home about. Beds were comfy but could definitely use extra pillows. Pillows we had were flat and 1 per head. That would really be my only complaint. If we had stayed more then 1 night I would have asked for more pillows. There is a kids playground, it could use an upgrade but in all honestly it was kinda cool. Full timber playground with a metal slide. None of that fancy plastic. My kids loved it and reminded me of my childhood.
If you need somewhere to stay with more space then the average place then give it a go.    I hope they do well in the future.
showerReviews.author: Katherine Moseley

locations.title: Bakers Point

showerReviews.reviewText: One of my favourite camps in tassie - only thing to warn about is the terrible dirt road leading down to Bakers Point. No matter how many times I’ve visited, the corrugation is so bad that I have to crawl along at 20km/hr (note I am in a campervan) so just keep that in mind. Nice & quiet in winter. Packed in summer. Industrial bins available at exit. Maintained drop toilets. Tank water. Dump point. Maybe around 20 sites available. River nice for swimming in summer. Unpowered sites ($13/n tickets from reception hut at entrance). Lots of wildlife so please respect their habitat 💕
showerReviews.author: Sam

showerReviews.reviewText: Top spot. Enjoyable camping area close to the water. Toilets, hybrid. Showers back near ranger's kiosk. Token operated. $2 A token. 1 token was enough to shower and wash my hair. Toilets stink. Oh well, can't have everything. Rain water available on tap. Can have campfires in season in the fireplaces provided, as long as you bring your own firewood. $13 A night for two people. $16 A night if you want power. Powered sites are near the ranger's kiosk and showers. The toilets are flush toilets here too. Skips for rubbish, and black water dumping points. Plenty of wildlife, although wombats are scarce on the ground now due to the mange. A pretty good deal all round. Please stick to the speed limits though.
showerReviews.author: Stuart UnMcKleaine

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great place to park it up for a few days.
Showers, toilets and powered sites available near rangers office. $2 a token for 4 min for showers. $ 16 per night 2 ppl powered, $13 un powered with parks pass
Toilets at other campgrounds also.
Bring own drinking water.
Fire wood for sale at rangers office which, when we got some, had kindling and a couple of fire lighters in it.
Fires only permitted at Bakers point camping area in designated fire pits only. A few walks in the area and variety of curious wildlife.
showerReviews.author: Carly Newnes

locations.title: Comfort Inn Devonport

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our stay at the Comfort Inn Devonport, Tasmania was absolutely wonderful from check-in to check-out.
From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel genuinely welcome by the friendly and helpful staff. The room was exceptionally clean and very well presented, with décor that was thoughtfully and tastefully selected.
The room was well equipped with everything we needed, including tea and coffee making facilities and a microwave, which was greatly appreciated. The availability of a washing machine for guest use was also a fantastic bonus, especially for travellers.
Overall, everything about our stay was perfect. Comfort, cleanliness, and attention to detail truly stood out. We would happily stay here again and highly recommend the Comfort Inn Devonport to anyone visiting the area.
showerReviews.author: Kim Manski

showerReviews.reviewText: hostel was alright, owner was nice, the work situation wasn't too good, to be honest. showers go for 4 minutes then there's a 2 minute break after which you can go again. kitchen was crowded in the evening. only 2 computers, no wifi. met a lot of great people there and there is dart and billiard. just a few words of advise: if you intend to rent a car, to get to work or whatsoever, DO NOT rent with tassie car rentals, it literally took them 2 month to transfer our 500 dollar deposit back and we had to conatct our lawyer, just so other people do not fall for these scammers. we were under 21 and they seemed like out only option, which we regretted deeply afterwards

showerReviews.reviewText:
If I could give 0 stars, I would give them. The facilities in this hostel are totally down and except that we found mold in the curtain in our room. They offered us another room but still with mold in the courtain. We paid for a whole week and even if they had no mold free room for us they were not willing to give us the money back. I have asthma and we told them. We couldn't stay there checking out after one night and lost 340$.
They told us that they clean the courtains oftenly with mold killer. After our reclamation they washed the curtain again and after that it was so much cleaner than before that I can't believe they wash them often. The whole hostel smells very humid.
Also the aura is really bad. This hostel was an home for elderlys before and it looks actually still the same.
Everytime we told some local where we stayed they knew immediately that's a shity place.
showerReviews.author: Sophia Müller

locations.title: Devonport Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText: The Devonport Backpackers has a really good feel to it. Located in an interesting Federation styled building it may not look all that impressive on the outside but inside it's clean, the staff member was welcoming and felt comfortable. The bathroom didn't have the best ventilation but the water pressure was amazing. The best water pressure that I have experienced - ever. The bedroom was clean and the bed comfortable enough and didn't have any squeaks. The kitchen area is large and the lounge area is inviting. Overall I really enjoyed this hostel and will consider it my first choice when staying in Devonport.
showerReviews.author: Sam Connelly

locations.title: Bee Body & Soul

showerReviews.reviewText: The massage room was unbearably cold, and unfortunately, I had to cut my massage short. Understandably, it’s winter in Tasmania, but the oil heater was simply insufficient for the space. Even the lovely therapist was rugged up in a puffer jacket, which says a lot about how cold it was. The whole building felt unpleasantly cold overall there was another lady in the waiting room sitting with a blanket over her. I asked the therapist if we could turn the heater up as I was cold but she said it was at the max and had been on since the morning. Hard to enjoy a massage when you have (pictured) this many towels surrounding you. I’d recommend implementing better heating solutions to ensure a more comfortable experience for both clients and staff.
showerReviews.author: Emma Martin

showerReviews.reviewText:
The sanctuary was in terrible condition.
This is meant to be a luxury spa but I wouldn’t call it that, kind of more like a health hazard.
There was mould in the steam room, the cold water pool was brown, the sauna spoon was broken and you couldn’t use it to put water on the rocks and there were clumps of hair in the shower.
I’m not sure how this place manages to get away with the poor conditions and quality they provided people

showerReviews.reviewText: We were return guests, there was no change room available for us, so after waiting a while we were offered a side room. Then when we were taken to the spa it was 10 minutes later than our booked time. We were told a bell would ring when our time was up, the bell rang 5 minutes before our actual time, so we missed out on 15 minutes of our booked time. Our bathers all discoloured from the level of chlorine in the spa and my skin was extremely dry. It’s a beautiful location and relaxing experience but these things definitely put a damper on our experience.
showerReviews.author: Belinda Phelan

locations.title: BFT Burnie

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined BFT 3 weeks on a friend's recommendation and haven't been dissapointed. Staff have been friendly, welcoming and helpful.
The various workouts have been what I needed to kick-start my new exercise regime. There are 6 days worth of classes with classes starting at from 5am and 6 or so classes a day to suit.
Located near the beach great for a before or after gym walk. Parking is plenty and right at the door.
The gym itself has toilet and shower facilities to enable the workout then go straight to work.
BFT is no locking contracts and it's pay per fortnight.
I like that after each session I can see where I'm at and how I've gone through the heart monitoring system.
They also have on the premises an Evolt body measuring system.
showerReviews.author: Amanda Farns

locations.title: Muscle Up Health And Performance Cooee

showerReviews.reviewText:
If I could give a rating of less than one star, I would.

Firstly, there are these divots in the ground which I’m guessing are there from the old bowling lanes, creating a serious hazard. Sometimes your dumbbells would just roll away and if you are really lucky you might even roll your ankle.

There’s also no water dispenser and no vending machine with water. Instead, you’re left with filling your water bottle from the bathroom tap, which is just unacceptable for any gym.

The changing facilities are another issue. There are two rooms: one large and somewhat acceptable, but if that’s in use, you’re forced into a cramped space that is a converted toilet stall next to the literal toilet stalls. The lighting is on a sensor, which turns off after a few minutes. So, you’ll find yourself in the shower, naked and scrambling to get dry and dressed in the dark, with just one hook for your belongings.

The sound system is a joke. With only a few large speakers scattered around, the volume can be overpowering if you’re near one, drowning out your headphones. And when the music randomly stops, you’re left in an awkward silence in a gym setting.

Then there’s the sauna—a total disaster. It’s never clean, with only an old rag available for wiping down surfaces. The booking system involves writing your name on a whiteboard, making it easy for someone to erase your reservation. I often found the sauna turned off, and after two months of my membership, it was broken entirely.

When I raised these concerns with the staff, I was told that the owner, Anthony, would address them when he gets back from a holiday in Europe. Oh you’re gym is half finished and the play is to go and chill out on the other side of the world?

Then there was the poor equipment, poor attitude from staff, dishonest and unclear terms of membership.

In summary, I have been a member of various gyms in around Australia over the past 10 years and this is the laziest most unprofessional gym of the lot, absolute disregard for fee paying members.

If you’re in Burnie and looking for a place to work out, save your time and money—there are far better options available ie. TSD, Zap, Anytime and Health Glow
showerReviews.author: Ethan

locations.title: Burnie Waterfront, West Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall Experience
Burnie Waterfront West Beach is a lovely spot to enjoy the coast and relax by the water. It’s ideal for a walk along the shore, a picnic, or simply taking in the fresh ocean air.

Beach & Water
The beach is clean and well-maintained, with gentle waves suitable for casual swimming or paddling. It’s a safe and enjoyable area for families and visitors of all ages.

Views & Scenery
The waterfront offers expansive views of the ocean and surrounding coastline. It’s a peaceful and scenic location, perfect for photography or simply enjoying a moment of calm by the sea.

Location & Access
The beach is easily accessible from Burnie, with convenient parking nearby. Its central location makes it a great stop for both locals and travelers exploring the area.

Overall Impression
Burnie Waterfront West Beach is a scenic and relaxing coastal destination. A beautiful spot to enjoy the ocean, go for a walk, or spend time outdoors with family and friends.

showerReviews.reviewText: The apartment was comfortable. Our only real issue was that the heatpump was off and it took a very long time to even slightly warm the place due to the high ceilings. It was 95% very clean but there were a few small, annoying things like a broken slat in the blind which allowed the room to be lit up by a street light, which did impact on comfort. The apartment we stayed in was roomy and we'll put together. There was plenty of seating in the lounge area and at the table. The kitchen had pretty much everything you need. There was even ice in the freezer. We had take away but you could easily cook a homestyle meal here. There was plenty of bedding, pillows, towels, extra blankets. Some soap was supplied. I highly recommend checking in earlier than 5pm, especially in winter.
showerReviews.author: Emma Archer

showerReviews.reviewText: The lady on the front desk was friendly,  accommodating & helpful, the showers were a bit tired, but spotlessly clean & hot water plentiful. It was quiet, a bit of highway noise,  but that was where we camped. A lot of permanent residents by the look of things, some of these, a bit unkempt & shabby, were a bit of a downfall for the park. But would go back again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Would not recommend this as a caravan park. It is full of permanent residents that have set up Shanties. We were there for 3 (too many) nights. Almost all day and late into the night a generator that one of the permanents have was running.  Had to make phone calls each night after 11pm to get it stopped.  Many of the permanents said this happens daily.
The facilities were dark, old and dirty, the showers had floor tiles missing to list only a few of this very tired camps failings.
There is also alot of road noise due to the caravan area being so close to Lyons St at the rear of the camp.
Never again will we book and pay ahead for multiple days without first checking it out.
With a bit of work this place could be really nice again.  The entry is lovely and so are the internet photos but alas that's as far as it goes.
The fees were almost the same as the camp down the road which was far superior for quiet and cleanliness, wish we had rebooked there. Just thought by the photos this would be a lovely place to be. 😟

Great campground if you are planning to go to Cradle Mountain and you want hot shower!! They also have bbq and other amenities like microwave, rice cooker, fridge and a pot to boil hot water.
Good value for money, there was plenty of space. we paid 15$/pp for an unpowered site. Plus they have the cafe open from 8am and the coffee is absolutely delicious!
showerReviews.author: Mariona EL

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stumbled upon this lovely campground during our road trip around Cradle Mountain, and what a beautiful surprise it was! We had only planned to stay one night but ended up staying four, that's how much we loved it.

From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by the friendly managers. Their kindness and generosity made us feel at home right away. The facilities are spotless and well-maintained. Every morning, one of the managers takes great care of the amenities to keep everything clean and tidy.

We also had several breakfasts at the little café next to the campground, and it was absolutely delicious, great food at very reasonable prices. The value for money here is excellent overall.

And how could we forget the resident chicken who stole our hearts? Every morning and evening, she came to greet us and even followed us around the campground. Such a sweet and unexpected companion.

Thank you again for your warm hospitality and all the helpful advice you shared with us during our stay. If you're looking for a peaceful, welcoming spot to rest during your travels, we couldn't recommend this place more. A true gem full of warmth and serenity.

Ana and Bastien
showerReviews.author: De Castilla Ana

showerReviews.reviewText: I couldn’t imagine how busy this place gets in summer when even winter was busy (half full). Half the campsites are closed during winter, so about 8 of each remain (powered & unpowered $16/20N). Can pay (& purchase shower tokens) at visitor centre, or pay by card at camp entry. National parks pass required. Laundry available with 2 washers ($5) & 2 driers ($4) (medium capacity loads). Washer took 36mins, dryer took 50mins (though didn’t fully dry clothes). Shower tokens can also be purchased at the laundry ($2 for 4mins of hot water. Alternatively cold water is always available, if you dare - it’s freezing). 3 showers & 4 flushing toilets (incl 1 wheelchair accessible) in female block (assuming male block similar). Covered shelter with various tables & 2x BBQ’s + a sink. Bins including recycling. Taps & grey water disposal available on powered sites. Toilet dump points not available here. The river runs along the unpowered sites which is lovely & we spotted platypus.
showerReviews.author: Sam

locations.title: Penguin Caravan Park

showerReviews.reviewText: Overpriced for an unpowered site @ $40/ night waterfront or non-waterfront is the same price 🙄. Most expensive we've had travelling clockwise from Launceston. The olds had a non-waterfront powered site at $45/night which seems on par with other caravan parks (waterfront powered is $55/ night). However, in terms of amenities, there is no camp kitchen or undercover areas! Toilets and showers are being renovated and you can see that it's going to be nice and bright. Showers at least were hot and wasn't coin operated. We got 1 bar of 4G with Telstra.
showerReviews.author: Hwee Carter

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location but the ocean let down by circumstances and an aging park.
We paid for a powered, level RV site for our motorhome.
Ongoing construction to the sole toilet/shower block resulted in the men's section being made completely unavailable for toilet and showers hours after we'd checked in and being told it would be ready by the afternoon.
On top of this a region wide power outage after our arrival left us without power for some time.
No camp kitchen or bbq facilities on site was also a let down.
Staff were friendly but limited in their ability to overcome the challenges.
showerReviews.author: Emanuel Spinola

showerReviews.reviewText:
We love it here - second stay and we'll be back again. The location is amazing and they allow enclosed fire pots which is a must for camling! Bathrooms are basic but we've been here 5 nights and they have always been clean and are as expected for a caravan park. Most of the new showers are done now (Jan 25).

The caretaker is really friendly. The spots aren't clearly marked and we accidentally set up over 2 spots causing a bit of a problem with their other booking. They were kind enough to make it work for everyone without making us pack up and move again, much appreciated as our set up is a lot of work!
showerReviews.author: Rachel Coote

showerReviews.reviewText:
Another stay here.
Ive read some average reviews so wanted to add mine.
Location awesome.
Great size sites. Most super grassy.
Dogs welcome. Dog beach right there.
Amenities are old style but freshly tiled and painted. Cleaned daily.
Prices standard for p/w.
Staff friendly and welcoming.
Bonus free penguin viewing (may be noisey lol) as the waddle up, red light use only.
Nearly all sites have sea or beach views.
Fires allowed.
showerReviews.author: Amanda Farns

showerReviews.author: Karyn Meers

showerReviews.reviewText:
Greens Beach is absolutely fabulous and having the shop and golf course add to the experience.
However I found the park lacking. The old amenities are kept clean enough but don't forget your dollar for 4 minutes of hot water.
They only have bore water and don't try boiling it for a cuppa.
No dump point located on site and was told the closest was Beaconsfield 20 minutes away (but don't ask where because they cant tell you) It's actually at the football field which I had to research myself.
No sign of a camp kitchen.
Paying $50 per night with facilities lacking is way too steep.
I travel alone with my dog and really think a single supplement should be considered. I questioned the price when booking and was told he'd see what he could do but charged me top dollar.
I am always very honest with my reviews and hope this is of assistance.
showerReviews.author: Paula Gett

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a great stay at Greens Beach over Easter. Dean was very friendly and helpful. We were so grateful to borrow a fire pit, it really made our stay so much better! The shower block was reasonably clean and our end of the park was very calm even with all the ( well behaved ) dogs! Mum hired the on-site caravan which looked super neat and tidy but needs an electric blanket and warmer bedding for the cold nights. Very well maintained park with the bonus of the Greens Beach Store within a stones throw. We’ll be back!
showerReviews.author: Jessica Csendes

showerReviews.reviewText:
Recently stayed for a 2 week period and we LOVED IT! We had not one issue at all!! our site was super big, drinkable water was easily accessible and The amenities and laundry were always kept clean and fresh and Dean is an absolute pleasure, super helpful, friendly and cheerful! Or 3y/o was constantly lingering around chatting to him about almost everything and dean was more than happy to listen to him (and baby shark) 🤣 with the cleanliness of the park you can definitely tell that Dean takes pride in what he does!!

We’re booked in for another 2 weeks next year and it can’t come around quick enough! We had the most enjoyable time at the greens beach caravan park!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lovely peaceful van park situated between the beach and a golf course on a No through road so little traffic - Blissfully quiet at night.
The aging facilities are spotlessly clean. Hot showers are available for $1 for 4 minutes something I didn’t realise while waiting for the water to heat while standing under the cold water.
Dean, the manager is fantastic, always available and ready with a smile. We enjoyed our 4 night stay and definitely stay again when in the area.

locations.title: Midway point sulphur creek

showerReviews.reviewText:
A popular campground. Views out to Bass Strait. Room for 10 to 12 caravans if campers park in an orderly considerate manner. Well grassed and reasonably level. Close to beach.
Nearest amenities are in Penguin.
Slight road noise but didn’t bother us. Freight Trains run 3 times a day right between the campground and the beach. Not noisy and they travel very slowly.
Have stayed here before. Would stay again.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Phone booking, 3 n April, 2 adults.
Easy access, great staff, large site and terrific view over the lake.
Amenities are ensuite style, spotlessly clean, they have a 5 minutes shower timer, big shower head and glass wall, no icky curtain. plenty of space for drying/dressing.
Laundry facilities, 2 machines and dryers Coin operated.
Camp kitchen is high set overlooking the lake and is well appointed.
Central position for town access as well as day trips.

locations.title: Burnie by the Bay

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is great, but so loud whenever you go there is noise. Furniture was old and damaged dining chairs have wobbly legs we couldn’t sit on a couple of them as they swayed. All the vinyl is torn, really shabby. Needs proper bathmats as shower and bathroom so slippery. Not great for elderly people because of the above.

Beds comfortable. .but all of us have bites on our necks and faces so possibly bedbugs
showerReviews.author: Amanda Henderson-Marks

showerReviews.reviewText:
A tin shed, yep, a tin shed. Incredibly noisy day and night. Booked and paid for 3 nights, lasted 2! First day advised the office lady of the slow draining sink in the bathroom and was told the owners were coming in two weeks and they would deal with it then. Had to brush our teeth in the shower, took me 5 minutes to clean the sink after a shave.
If the Bates Motel or the Guest House Paradiso was up the road,they would be a far better place to stay.
Not sure why people have given 4 and 5 star ratings, 🤔 possibly friends and family.
showerReviews.author: Norman Donald
